_v.en: The day when the faithless are exposed to the Fire, [He will say,] ‘Is this not a fact?’ They will say, ‘Yes, by our Lord!’ He will say, ‘So taste the punishment because of what you used to disbelieve.’

_v.ar: فَٱصْبِرْ كَمَا صَبَرَ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْعَزْمِ مِنَ ٱلرُّسُلِ وَلَا تَسْتَعْجِل لَّهُمْ ۚ كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ مَا يُوعَدُونَ لَمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا سَاعَةً مِّن نَّهَارٍۭ ۚ بَلَـٰغٌ ۚ فَهَلْ يُهْلَكُ إِلَّا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلْفَـٰسِقُونَ
_v.en: So be patient just as the resolute among the apostles were patient, and do not seek to hasten [the punishment] for them. The day when they see what they are promised, [it will be] as though they had remained [in the world] only an hour of a day. This is a proclamation. So shall anyone be destroyed except the transgressing lot?

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ أَضَلَّ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: Those who are [themselves] faithless and bar [others] from the way of Allah—He has rendered their works fruitless.

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَءَامَنُوا۟ بِمَا نُزِّلَ عَلَىٰ مُحَمَّدٍ وَهُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ ۙ كَفَّرَ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ وَأَصْلَحَ بَالَهُمْ
_v.en: But those who have faith and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down to Muhammad—and it is the truth from their Lord—He shall absolve them of their misdeeds and set right their affairs.

_v.ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلْبَـٰطِلَ وَأَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلْحَقَّ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضْرِبُ ٱللَّهُ لِلنَّاسِ أَمْثَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: That is because the faithless follow falsehood, and the faithful follow the truth from their Lord. That is how Allah draws comparisons for mankind.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا لَقِيتُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَضَرْبَ ٱلرِّقَابِ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَثْخَنتُمُوهُمْ فَشُدُّوا۟ ٱلْوَثَاقَ فَإِمَّا مَنًّۢا بَعْدُ وَإِمَّا فِدَآءً حَتَّىٰ تَضَعَ ٱلْحَرْبُ أَوْزَارَهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَوْ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ لَٱنتَصَرَ مِنْهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن لِّيَبْلُوَا۟ بَعْضَكُم بِبَعْضٍ ۗ وَٱلَّذِينَ قُتِلُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَلَن يُضِلَّ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: When you meet the faithless in battle, strike their necks. When you have thoroughly decimated them, bind the captives firmly. Thereafter either oblige them [by setting them free] or take ransom, until the war lays down its burdens. That [is Allah’s ordinance]. Had Allah wished He could have taken vengeance on them, but that He may test some of you by means of others. As for those who were slain in the way of Allah, He will not let their works go fruitless.

_v.ar: سَيَهْدِيهِمْ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَهُمْ
_v.en: He will guide them and set right their affairs,

_v.ar: وَيُدْخِلُهُمُ ٱلْجَنَّةَ عَرَّفَهَا لَهُمْ
_v.en: and admit them into paradise, with which He has acquainted them.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تَنصُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ يَنصُرْكُمْ وَيُثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَكُمْ
_v.en: O you who have faith! If you help Allah, He will help you and make your feet steady.

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فَتَعْسًا لَّهُمْ وَأَضَلَّ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: As for the faithless, their lot will be to fall [into ruin], and He will render their works fruitless.

_v.ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَرِهُوا۟ مَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ فَأَحْبَطَ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: That is because they loathed what Allah has sent down, so He made their works fail.

_v.ar: أَفَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ دَمَّرَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ وَلِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ أَمْثَـٰلُهَا
_v.en: Have they not travelled through the land so that they may observe how was the fate of those who were before them? Allah destroyed them, and a similar [fate] awaits these faithless.

_v.ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَوْلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَأَنَّ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ لَا مَوْلَىٰ لَهُمْ
_v.en: That is because Allah is the protector of the faithful, and because the faithless have no protector.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُدْخِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يَتَمَتَّعُونَ وَيَأْكُلُونَ كَمَا تَأْكُلُ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمُ وَٱلنَّارُ مَثْوًى لَّهُمْ
_v.en: Indeed Allah will admit those who have faith and do righteous deeds into gardens with streams running in them. As for the faithless, they enjoy and eat like the cattle do, and the Fire will be their [final] abode.

_v.ar: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ هِىَ أَشَدُّ قُوَّةً مِّن قَرْيَتِكَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَخْرَجَتْكَ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ فَلَا نَاصِرَ لَهُمْ
_v.en: How many a town We have destroyed which was more powerful than your town which expelled you, and they had no helper.

_v.ar: أَفَمَن كَانَ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ كَمَن زُيِّنَ لَهُۥ سُوٓءُ عَمَلِهِۦ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُم
_v.en: Is he who stands on a manifest proof from his Lord like those to whom the evil of their conduct is made to seem decorous and who follow their desires?

_v.ar: مَّثَلُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ٱلَّتِى وُعِدَ ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ ۖ فِيهَآ أَنْهَـٰرٌ مِّن مَّآءٍ غَيْرِ ءَاسِنٍ وَأَنْهَـٰرٌ مِّن لَّبَنٍ لَّمْ يَتَغَيَّرْ طَعْمُهُۥ وَأَنْهَـٰرٌ مِّنْ خَمْرٍ لَّذَّةٍ لِّلشَّـٰرِبِينَ وَأَنْهَـٰرٌ مِّنْ عَسَلٍ مُّصَفًّى ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ وَمَغْفِرَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ كَمَنْ هُوَ خَـٰلِدٌ فِى ٱلنَّارِ وَسُقُوا۟ مَآءً حَمِيمًا فَقَطَّعَ أَمْعَآءَهُمْ
_v.en: A description of the paradise promised to the Godwary: therein are streams of unstaling water and streams of milk unchanging in flavour, and streams of wine delicious to the drinkers, and streams of purified honey; there will be every kind of fruit in it for them, and forgiveness from their Lord. [Are such ones] like those who abide in the Fire and are given to drink boiling water which cuts up their bowels?

_v.ar: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَسْتَمِعُ إِلَيْكَ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا خَرَجُوا۟ مِنْ عِندِكَ قَالُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ مَاذَا قَالَ ءَانِفًا ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ طَبَعَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ
_v.en: There are some among them who prick up their ears at you. But when they go out from your presence, they say to those who have been given knowledge, ‘What did he say just now?’ They are the ones on whose hearts Allah has set a seal, and they follow their own desires.

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ ٱهْتَدَوْا۟ زَادَهُمْ هُدًى وَءَاتَىٰهُمْ تَقْوَىٰهُمْ
_v.en: As for those who are [rightly] guided, He enhances their guidance and invests them with their Godwariness.

_v.ar: فَهَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ أَن تَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً ۖ فَقَدْ جَآءَ أَشْرَاطُهَا ۚ فَأَنَّىٰ لَهُمْ إِذَا جَآءَتْهُمْ ذِكْرَىٰهُمْ
_v.en: Do they await anything except that the Hour should overtake them suddenly? Its portents have already come. When it overtakes them of what avail will the admonitions they were given?

_v.ar: فَٱعْلَمْ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْ لِذَنۢبِكَ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مُتَقَلَّبَكُمْ وَمَثْوَىٰكُمْ
_v.en: Know that there is no god except Allah, and plead [to Allah] for forgiveness of your sin and for the faithful, men and women. Allah knows your itinerary and your [final] abode.

_v.ar: وَيَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَتْ سُورَةٌ ۖ فَإِذَآ أُنزِلَتْ سُورَةٌ مُّحْكَمَةٌ وَذُكِرَ فِيهَا ٱلْقِتَالُ ۙ رَأَيْتَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَيْكَ نَظَرَ ٱلْمَغْشِىِّ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۖ فَأَوْلَىٰ لَهُمْ
_v.en: The faithful say, ‘If only a surah were sent down!’ But when a conclusive surah is sent down and war is mentioned in it, you see those in whose hearts is a sickness looking upon you with the look of someone fainting at death. So woe to them!

_v.ar: طَاعَةٌ وَقَوْلٌ مَّعْرُوفٌ ۚ فَإِذَا عَزَمَ ٱلْأَمْرُ فَلَوْ صَدَقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَّهُمْ
_v.en: Obedience and upright speech.... So when the matter has been resolved upon [concerning going to war], if they remain true to Allah that will surely be better for them.

_v.ar: فَهَلْ عَسَيْتُمْ إِن تَوَلَّيْتُمْ أَن تُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَتُقَطِّعُوٓا۟ أَرْحَامَكُمْ
_v.en: May it not be that if you were to wield authority you would cause corruption in the land and ill-treat your blood relations?

_v.ar: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَعَنَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ فَأَصَمَّهُمْ وَأَعْمَىٰٓ أَبْصَـٰرَهُمْ
_v.en: They are the ones whom Allah has cursed, so He made them deaf, and blinded their sight.

_v.ar: أَفَلَا يَتَدَبَّرُونَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ أَمْ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبٍ أَقْفَالُهَآ
_v.en: Do they not contemplate the Quran, or are there locks on the hearts?

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱرْتَدُّوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَدْبَـٰرِهِم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلْهُدَى ۙ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ سَوَّلَ لَهُمْ وَأَمْلَىٰ لَهُمْ
_v.en: Indeed those who turned their backs after the guidance had become clear to them, it was Satan who had seduced them, and he had given them [far-flung] hopes.

_v.ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ كَرِهُوا۟ مَا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ سَنُطِيعُكُمْ فِى بَعْضِ ٱلْأَمْرِ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ إِسْرَارَهُمْ
_v.en: That is because they said to those who loathed what Allah had sent down: ‘We shall obey you in some matters,’ and Allah knows their secret dealings.

_v.ar: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا تَوَفَّتْهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ يَضْرِبُونَ وُجُوهَهُمْ وَأَدْبَـٰرَهُمْ
_v.en: But how will it be [with them] when the angels take them away, striking their faces and their backs?!

_v.ar: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ ٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَآ أَسْخَطَ ٱللَّهَ وَكَرِهُوا۟ رِضْوَٰنَهُۥ فَأَحْبَطَ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: That, because they pursued what displeased Allah, and loathed His pleasure. So He has made their works fail.

_v.ar: أَمْ حَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ أَن لَّن يُخْرِجَ ٱللَّهُ أَضْغَـٰنَهُمْ
_v.en: Do those in whose hearts is a sickness suppose that Allah will not expose their spite?

_v.ar: وَلَوْ نَشَآءُ لَأَرَيْنَـٰكَهُمْ فَلَعَرَفْتَهُم بِسِيمَـٰهُمْ ۚ وَلَتَعْرِفَنَّهُمْ فِى لَحْنِ ٱلْقَوْلِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ أَعْمَـٰلَكُمْ
_v.en: If We wish, We will show them to you so that you recognize them by their mark. Yet you will recognize them by their tone of speech, and Allah knows your deeds.

_v.ar: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَعْلَمَ ٱلْمُجَـٰهِدِينَ مِنكُمْ وَٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ وَنَبْلُوَا۟ أَخْبَارَكُمْ
_v.en: We will surely test you until We ascertain those of you who wage jihad and those who are steadfast, and We shall appraise your record.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَشَآقُّوا۟ ٱلرَّسُولَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰ لَن يَضُرُّوا۟ ٱللَّهَ شَيْـًٔا وَسَيُحْبِطُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: Indeed those who are faithless and bar from the way of Allah and defy the Apostle after guidance has become clear to them, they will not hurt Allah in the least, and He shall make their works fail.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا۟ ٱلرَّسُولَ وَلَا تُبْطِلُوٓا۟ أَعْمَـٰلَكُمْ
_v.en: O you who have faith! Obey Allah and obey the Apostle, and do not render your works void.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ مَاتُوا۟ وَهُمْ كُفَّارٌ فَلَن يَغْفِرَ ٱللَّهُ لَهُمْ
_v.en: Indeed those who are faithless and bar from the way of Allah and then die faithless, Allah will never forgive them.

_v.ar: فَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَتَدْعُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلسَّلْمِ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَوْنَ وَٱللَّهُ مَعَكُمْ وَلَن يَتِرَكُمْ أَعْمَـٰلَكُمْ
_v.en: So do not slacken and [do not] call for peace when you have the upper hand and Allah is with you, and He will not stint [the reward of] your works.

_v.ar: إِنَّمَا ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا لَعِبٌ وَلَهْوٌ ۚ وَإِن تُؤْمِنُوا۟ وَتَتَّقُوا۟ يُؤْتِكُمْ أُجُورَكُمْ وَلَا يَسْـَٔلْكُمْ أَمْوَٰلَكُمْ
_v.en: The life of the world is just play and diversion, but if you are faithful and Godwary, He will give you your rewards, and will not ask your wealth [in return] from you.

_v.ar: إِن يَسْـَٔلْكُمُوهَا فَيُحْفِكُمْ تَبْخَلُوا۟ وَيُخْرِجْ أَضْغَـٰنَكُمْ
_v.en: Should He ask it from you and press you, you will be stingy, and He will expose your spite.

_v.ar: هَـٰٓأَنتُمْ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ تُدْعَوْنَ لِتُنفِقُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَمِنكُم مَّن يَبْخَلُ ۖ وَمَن يَبْخَلْ فَإِنَّمَا يَبْخَلُ عَن نَّفْسِهِۦ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ ٱلْغَنِىُّ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْفُقَرَآءُ ۚ وَإِن تَتَوَلَّوْا۟ يَسْتَبْدِلْ قَوْمًا غَيْرَكُمْ ثُمَّ لَا يَكُونُوٓا۟ أَمْثَـٰلَكُم
_v.en: Ah! There you are, being invited to spend in the way of Allah; yet among you there are those who are stingy; and whoever is stingy is stingy only to himself. Allah is the All-sufficient, and you are all-needy, and if you turn away He will replace you with another people, and they will not be like you.

_v.ar: إِنَّا فَتَحْنَا لَكَ فَتْحًا مُّبِينًا
_v.en: Indeed We have inaugurated for you a clear victory,

_v.ar: لِّيَغْفِرَ لَكَ ٱللَّهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِن ذَنۢبِكَ وَمَا تَأَخَّرَ وَيُتِمَّ نِعْمَتَهُۥ عَلَيْكَ وَيَهْدِيَكَ صِرَٰطًا مُّسْتَقِيمًا
_v.en: that Allah may forgive you what is past of your sin and what is to come, and that He may perfect His blessing upon you and guide you on a straight path,

_v.ar: وَيَنصُرَكَ ٱللَّهُ نَصْرًا عَزِيزًا
_v.en: and Allah will help you with a mighty help.

_v.ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ ٱلسَّكِينَةَ فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ لِيَزْدَادُوٓا۟ إِيمَـٰنًا مَّعَ إِيمَـٰنِهِمْ ۗ وَلِلَّهِ جُنُودُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
_v.en: It is He who sent down composure into the hearts of the faithful that they might enhance in their faith. To Allah belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.

_v.ar: لِّيُدْخِلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا وَيُكَفِّرَ عَنْهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ذَٰلِكَ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ فَوْزًا عَظِيمًا
_v.en: That He may admit the faithful, men and women, into gardens with streams running in them, to remain in them [forever], and that He may absolve them of their misdeeds. That is a great success with Allah.

_v.ar: وَيُعَذِّبَ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ وَٱلْمُنَـٰفِقَـٰتِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ وَٱلْمُشْرِكَـٰتِ ٱلظَّآنِّينَ بِٱللَّهِ ظَنَّ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۚ عَلَيْهِمْ دَآئِرَةُ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۖ وَغَضِبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَعَنَهُمْ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُمْ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَسَآءَتْ مَصِيرًا
_v.en: That He may punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the polytheists, men and women, who entertain a bad opinion of Allah. For them shall be an adverse turn of fortune: Allah is wrathful with them and He has cursed them, and prepared hell for them and it is an evil destination.

_v.ar: وَلِلَّهِ جُنُودُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا
_v.en: To Allah belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ شَـٰهِدًا وَمُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
_v.en: Indeed We have sent you as a witness, and as a bearer of good news and warner,

_v.ar: لِّتُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَتُعَزِّرُوهُ وَتُوَقِّرُوهُ وَتُسَبِّحُوهُ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
_v.en: that you may have faith in Allah and His Apostle, and that you may support him and revere him, and that you may glorify Him morning and evening.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُبَايِعُونَكَ إِنَّمَا يُبَايِعُونَ ٱللَّهَ يَدُ ٱللَّهِ فَوْقَ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۚ فَمَن نَّكَثَ فَإِنَّمَا يَنكُثُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَنْ أَوْفَىٰ بِمَا عَـٰهَدَ عَلَيْهُ ٱللَّهَ فَسَيُؤْتِيهِ أَجْرًا عَظِيمًا
_v.en: Indeed those who swear allegiance to you, swear allegiance only to Allah: the hand of Allah is above their hands. Then whosoever breaks his oath, breaks it only to his own detriment, and whoever fulfills the covenant he has made with Allah, He will give him a great reward.

_v.ar: سَيَقُولُ لَكَ ٱلْمُخَلَّفُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَعْرَابِ شَغَلَتْنَآ أَمْوَٰلُنَا وَأَهْلُونَا فَٱسْتَغْفِرْ لَنَا ۚ يَقُولُونَ بِأَلْسِنَتِهِم مَّا لَيْسَ فِى قُلُوبِهِمْ ۚ قُلْ فَمَن يَمْلِكُ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًٔا إِنْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ ضَرًّا أَوْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ نَفْعًۢا ۚ بَلْ كَانَ ٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرًۢا
_v.en: The Bedouins who had stayed back [from joining the Prophet in his ‘umrah journey to Makkah] will tell you, ‘Our possessions and families kept us occupied. So plead [to Allah] for our forgiveness!’ They will say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, ‘Whether He desires to cause you harm or desires to bring you benefit, who can be of any avail to you against Allah[’s will]? Indeed Allah is well aware of what you do.’

_v.ar: بَلْ ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَنقَلِبَ ٱلرَّسُولُ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِيهِمْ أَبَدًا وَزُيِّنَ ذَٰلِكَ فِى قُلُوبِكُمْ وَظَنَنتُمْ ظَنَّ ٱلسَّوْءِ وَكُنتُمْ قَوْمًۢا بُورًا
_v.en: Rather, you thought that the Apostle and the faithful will not ever return to their folks, and that was made to seem decorous to your hearts; you entertained evil thoughts, and you were a ruined lot.

_v.ar: وَمَن لَّمْ يُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ فَإِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ سَعِيرًا
_v.en: Those who have no faith in Allah and His Apostle [should know that] We have prepared a blaze for the faithless.

_v.ar: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ يَغْفِرُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا
_v.en: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth: He forgives whomever He wishes, and punishes whomever He wishes, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

_v.ar: سَيَقُولُ ٱلْمُخَلَّفُونَ إِذَا ٱنطَلَقْتُمْ إِلَىٰ مَغَانِمَ لِتَأْخُذُوهَا ذَرُونَا نَتَّبِعْكُمْ ۖ يُرِيدُونَ أَن يُبَدِّلُوا۟ كَلَـٰمَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قُل لَّن تَتَّبِعُونَا كَذَٰلِكُمْ قَالَ ٱللَّهُ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ فَسَيَقُولُونَ بَلْ تَحْسُدُونَنَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
_v.en: [In the near future] when you will set out to capture booty, those who stayed behind [in this journey] will say, : ‘Let us follow you.’ They desire to change the word of Allah. Say, ‘You will never follow us! Allah has said thus beforehand.’ Then they will say, ‘You are envious of us.’ Indeed, they do not understand but a little.

_v.ar: قُل لِّلْمُخَلَّفِينَ مِنَ ٱلْأَعْرَابِ سَتُدْعَوْنَ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ أُو۟لِى بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ تُقَـٰتِلُونَهُمْ أَوْ يُسْلِمُونَ ۖ فَإِن تُطِيعُوا۟ يُؤْتِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ أَجْرًا حَسَنًا ۖ وَإِن تَتَوَلَّوْا۟ كَمَا تَوَلَّيْتُم مِّن قَبْلُ يُعَذِّبْكُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
_v.en: Say to the Bedouins who stayed behind, ‘[Later on] you will be called against a people of a great might: they will either embrace Islam, or you will fight them. So if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward; but if you turn away like you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.’

_v.ar: لَّيْسَ عَلَى ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى ٱلْأَعْرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى ٱلْمَرِيضِ حَرَجٌ ۗ وَمَن يُطِعِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ يُعَذِّبْهُ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
_v.en: There is no blame on the blind, nor is there any blame on the lame, nor is there blame on the sick [if they are unable to go out with the troops to face the enemies]; and whoever obeys Allah and His Apostle, He will admit him into gardens with streams running in them, and whoever refuses to comply, He will punish him with a painful punishment.

_v.ar: لَّقَدْ رَضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِذْ يُبَايِعُونَكَ تَحْتَ ٱلشَّجَرَةِ فَعَلِمَ مَا فِى قُلُوبِهِمْ فَأَنزَلَ ٱلسَّكِينَةَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَأَثَـٰبَهُمْ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا
_v.en: Allah was certainly pleased with the faithful when they swore allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down composure on them, and requited them with a victory near at hand

_v.ar: وَمَغَانِمَ كَثِيرَةً يَأْخُذُونَهَا ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا
_v.en: and abundant spoils that they will capture, and Allah is all-mighty, all-wise.

_v.ar: وَعَدَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ مَغَانِمَ كَثِيرَةً تَأْخُذُونَهَا فَعَجَّلَ لَكُمْ هَـٰذِهِۦ وَكَفَّ أَيْدِىَ ٱلنَّاسِ عَنكُمْ وَلِتَكُونَ ءَايَةً لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَيَهْدِيَكُمْ صِرَٰطًا مُّسْتَقِيمًا
_v.en: Allah has promised you abundant spoils, which you will capture. He has expedited this one for you, and withheld men’s hands from you, so that it may be a sign for the faithful, and that He may guide you to a straight path.

_v.ar: وَأُخْرَىٰ لَمْ تَقْدِرُوا۟ عَلَيْهَا قَدْ أَحَاطَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرًا
_v.en: And other [spoils as well] which you have not yet captured: Allah has comprehended them, and Allah has power over all things.

_v.ar: وَلَوْ قَـٰتَلَكُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوَلَّوُا۟ ٱلْأَدْبَـٰرَ ثُمَّ لَا يَجِدُونَ وَلِيًّا وَلَا نَصِيرًا
_v.en: If the faithless fight you, they will turn their backs [to flee]. Then they will not find any protector or helper.

_v.ar: سُنَّةَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّتِى قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّةِ ٱللَّهِ تَبْدِيلًا
_v.en: [It is] Allah’s precedent that has passed before, and you will never find any change in Allah’s precedent.

_v.ar: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى كَفَّ أَيْدِيَهُمْ عَنكُمْ وَأَيْدِيَكُمْ عَنْهُم بِبَطْنِ مَكَّةَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَنْ أَظْفَرَكُمْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرًا
_v.en: It is He who withheld their hands from you, and your hands from them, in the valley of Makkah, after He had given you victory over them, and Allah sees best what you do.

_v.ar: هُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَصَدُّوكُمْ عَنِ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ وَٱلْهَدْىَ مَعْكُوفًا أَن يَبْلُغَ مَحِلَّهُۥ ۚ وَلَوْلَا رِجَالٌ مُّؤْمِنُونَ وَنِسَآءٌ مُّؤْمِنَـٰتٌ لَّمْ تَعْلَمُوهُمْ أَن تَطَـُٔوهُمْ فَتُصِيبَكُم مِّنْهُم مَّعَرَّةٌۢ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۖ لِّيُدْخِلَ ٱللَّهُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ لَوْ تَزَيَّلُوا۟ لَعَذَّبْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
_v.en: They are the ones who disbelieved and barred you from the Sacred Mosque, and kept the offering from reaching its destination. And were it not for [certain] faithful men and faithful women, whom you did not know—lest you should trample them, and thus the blame for [killing] them should fall on you unawares; [He held you back] so that Allah may admit into His mercy whomever He wishes. Had they been separate, We would have surely punished the faithless among them with a painful punishment.

_v.ar: إِذْ جَعَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلْحَمِيَّةَ حَمِيَّةَ ٱلْجَـٰهِلِيَّةِ فَأَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ وَعَلَى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَأَلْزَمَهُمْ كَلِمَةَ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ وَكَانُوٓا۟ أَحَقَّ بِهَا وَأَهْلَهَا ۚ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمًا
_v.en: When the faithless nourished bigotry in their hearts, the bigotry of pagan ignorance, Allah sent down His composure upon His Apostle and the faithful, and made them abide by the word of Godwariness, for they were the worthiest of it and deserved it, and Allah has knowledge of all things.

_v.ar: لَّقَدْ صَدَقَ ٱللَّهُ رَسُولَهُ ٱلرُّءْيَا بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ لَتَدْخُلُنَّ ٱلْمَسْجِدَ ٱلْحَرَامَ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ءَامِنِينَ مُحَلِّقِينَ رُءُوسَكُمْ وَمُقَصِّرِينَ لَا تَخَافُونَ ۖ فَعَلِمَ مَا لَمْ تَعْلَمُوا۟ فَجَعَلَ مِن دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا
_v.en: Certainly Allah has fulfilled His Apostle’s vision in all truth: You will surely enter the Sacred Mosque, God willing, in safety and without any fear, with your heads shaven or hair cropped. So He knew what you did not know, and He assigned [you] besides that a victory near at hand.

_v.ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُۥ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ ٱلْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلدِّينِ كُلِّهِۦ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ شَهِيدًا
_v.en: It is He who has sent His Apostle with guidance and the true religion, that He may make it prevail over all religions, and Allah suffices as witness.

_v.ar: مُّحَمَّدٌ رَّسُولُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥٓ أَشِدَّآءُ عَلَى ٱلْكُفَّارِ رُحَمَآءُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ تَرَىٰهُمْ رُكَّعًا سُجَّدًا يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضْوَٰنًا ۖ سِيمَاهُمْ فِى وُجُوهِهِم مِّنْ أَثَرِ ٱلسُّجُودِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مَثَلُهُمْ فِى ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ ۚ وَمَثَلُهُمْ فِى ٱلْإِنجِيلِ كَزَرْعٍ أَخْرَجَ شَطْـَٔهُۥ فَـَٔازَرَهُۥ فَٱسْتَغْلَظَ فَٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَىٰ سُوقِهِۦ يُعْجِبُ ٱلزُّرَّاعَ لِيَغِيظَ بِهِمُ ٱلْكُفَّارَ ۗ وَعَدَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ مِنْهُم مَّغْفِرَةً وَأَجْرًا عَظِيمًۢا
_v.en: Muhammad, the Apostle of Allah, and those who are with him are hard against the faithless and merciful amongst themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in worship], seeking Allah’s grace, and [His] pleasure. Their mark is [visible] on their faces, from the effect of prostration. Such is their description in the Torah and their description in the Evangel. Like a tillage that sends out its shoots and builds them up, and they grow stout and settle on their stalks, impressing the sowers, so that He may enrage the faithless by them. Allah has promised those of them who have faith and do righteous deeds forgiveness and a great reward.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ بَيْنَ يَدَىِ ٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
_v.en: O you who have faith! Do not venture ahead of Allah and His Apostle, and be wary of Allah. Indeed Allah is all-hearing, all-knowing.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَرْفَعُوٓا۟ أَصْوَٰتَكُمْ فَوْقَ صَوْتِ ٱلنَّبِىِّ وَلَا تَجْهَرُوا۟ لَهُۥ بِٱلْقَوْلِ كَجَهْرِ بَعْضِكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ أَن تَحْبَطَ أَعْمَـٰلُكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَشْعُرُونَ
_v.en: O you who have faith! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, and do not speak aloud to him like you shout to one another, lest your works should fail without your being aware.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَغُضُّونَ أَصْوَٰتَهُمْ عِندَ رَسُولِ ٱللَّهِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱمْتَحَنَ ٱللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ ۚ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ
_v.en: Indeed those who lower their voices in the presence of the Apostle of Allah—they are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for Godwariness. For them will be forgiveness and a great reward.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُنَادُونَكَ مِن وَرَآءِ ٱلْحُجُرَٰتِ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
_v.en: Indeed those who call you from behind the apartments, most of them do not use their reason.

_v.ar: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ صَبَرُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ تَخْرُجَ إِلَيْهِمْ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَّهُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
_v.en: Had they been patient until you came out for them, it would have been better for them, and Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن جَآءَكُمْ فَاسِقٌۢ بِنَبَإٍ فَتَبَيَّنُوٓا۟ أَن تُصِيبُوا۟ قَوْمًۢا بِجَهَـٰلَةٍ فَتُصْبِحُوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلْتُمْ نَـٰدِمِينَ
_v.en: O you who have faith! If a vicious character brings you some news, verify it, lest you should visit [harm] on some people out of ignorance, and then become regretful for what you have done.

_v.ar: وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ فِيكُمْ رَسُولَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ لَوْ يُطِيعُكُمْ فِى كَثِيرٍ مِّنَ ٱلْأَمْرِ لَعَنِتُّمْ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ حَبَّبَ إِلَيْكُمُ ٱلْإِيمَـٰنَ وَزَيَّنَهُۥ فِى قُلُوبِكُمْ وَكَرَّهَ إِلَيْكُمُ ٱلْكُفْرَ وَٱلْفُسُوقَ وَٱلْعِصْيَانَ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلرَّٰشِدُونَ
_v.en: Know that the Apostle of Allah is among you. Should he comply with you in many matters, you would surely suffer. But Allah has endeared faith to you and made it appealing in your hearts, and He has made hateful to you faithlessness, transgression and disobedience. It is such who are the right-minded—

_v.ar: فَضْلًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَنِعْمَةً ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
_v.en: a grace and blessing from Allah, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.

_v.ar: وَإِن طَآئِفَتَانِ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱقْتَتَلُوا۟ فَأَصْلِحُوا۟ بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَإِنۢ بَغَتْ إِحْدَىٰهُمَا عَلَى ٱلْأُخْرَىٰ فَقَـٰتِلُوا۟ ٱلَّتِى تَبْغِى حَتَّىٰ تَفِىٓءَ إِلَىٰٓ أَمْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن فَآءَتْ فَأَصْلِحُوا۟ بَيْنَهُمَا بِٱلْعَدْلِ وَأَقْسِطُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُقْسِطِينَ
_v.en: If two groups of the faithful fight one another, make peace between them. But if one party of them aggresses against the other, fight the one which aggresses until it returns to Allah’s ordinance. Then, if it returns, make peace between them fairly, and do justice. Indeed Allah loves the just.

_v.ar: إِنَّمَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِخْوَةٌ فَأَصْلِحُوا۟ بَيْنَ أَخَوَيْكُمْ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
_v.en: The faithful are indeed brothers. Therefore, make peace between your brothers and be wary of Allah, so that you may receive [His] mercy.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا يَسْخَرْ قَوْمٌ مِّن قَوْمٍ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونُوا۟ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَلَا نِسَآءٌ مِّن نِّسَآءٍ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُنَّ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُنَّ ۖ وَلَا تَلْمِزُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَلَا تَنَابَزُوا۟ بِٱلْأَلْقَـٰبِ ۖ بِئْسَ ٱلِٱسْمُ ٱلْفُسُوقُ بَعْدَ ٱلْإِيمَـٰنِ ۚ وَمَن لَّمْ يَتُبْ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
_v.en: O you who have faith! Let not any people ridicule another people: it may be that they are better than they are; nor let women [ridicule] women: it may be that they are better than they are. And do not defame one another, nor insult one another by [calling] nicknames. How evil are profane names subsequent to faith! As for those who are not penitent [of their past conduct]—such are the wrongdoers.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱجْتَنِبُوا۟ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ ٱلظَّنِّ إِنَّ بَعْضَ ٱلظَّنِّ إِثْمٌ ۖ وَلَا تَجَسَّسُوا۟ وَلَا يَغْتَب بَّعْضُكُم بَعْضًا ۚ أَيُحِبُّ أَحَدُكُمْ أَن يَأْكُلَ لَحْمَ أَخِيهِ مَيْتًا فَكَرِهْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ تَوَّابٌ رَّحِيمٌ
_v.en: O you who have faith! Avoid much suspicion; indeed some suspicions are sins. And do not spy on one another or backbite. Will any of you love to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would hate it. Be wary of Allah; indeed Allah is all-clement, all-merciful.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰكُم مِّن ذَكَرٍ وَأُنثَىٰ وَجَعَلْنَـٰكُمْ شُعُوبًا وَقَبَآئِلَ لِتَعَارَفُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّ أَكْرَمَكُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ أَتْقَىٰكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌ
_v.en: O mankind! Indeed, We created you from a male and a female, and made you nations and tribes that you may identify yourselves with one another. Indeed the noblest of you in the sight of Allah is the most Godwary among you. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-aware.

_v.ar: قَالَتِ ٱلْأَعْرَابُ ءَامَنَّا ۖ قُل لَّمْ تُؤْمِنُوا۟ وَلَـٰكِن قُولُوٓا۟ أَسْلَمْنَا وَلَمَّا يَدْخُلِ ٱلْإِيمَـٰنُ فِى قُلُوبِكُمْ ۖ وَإِن تُطِيعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ لَا يَلِتْكُم مِّنْ أَعْمَـٰلِكُمْ شَيْـًٔا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
_v.en: The Bedouins say, ‘We have faith.’ Say, ‘You do not have faith yet; rather, say, ‘‘We have embraced Islam,’’ for faith has not yet entered into your hearts. Yet if you obey Allah and His Apostle, He will not stint anything of [the reward of] your works. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’

_v.ar: إِنَّمَا ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَرْتَابُوا۟ وَجَـٰهَدُوا۟ بِأَمْوَٰلِهِمْ وَأَنفُسِهِمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصَّـٰدِقُونَ
_v.en: The faithful are only those who have attained faith in Allah and His Apostle and then have never doubted, and who wage jihad with their possessions and their persons in the way of Allah. It is they who are the truthful.

_v.ar: قُلْ أَتُعَلِّمُونَ ٱللَّهَ بِدِينِكُمْ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
_v.en: Say, ‘Will you inform Allah about your faith while Allah knows whatever there is in the heavens and whatever there is in the earth, and Allah has knowledge of all things?’

_v.ar: يَمُنُّونَ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ أَسْلَمُوا۟ ۖ قُل لَّا تَمُنُّوا۟ عَلَىَّ إِسْلَـٰمَكُم ۖ بَلِ ٱللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ هَدَىٰكُمْ لِلْإِيمَـٰنِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
_v.en: They count it as a favour to you that they have embraced Islam. Say, ‘Do not count your embracing of Islam as a favour to me. No, it is Allah who has done you a favour in that He has guided you to faith, if you are truthful [in your claim].

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ غَيْبَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بَصِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
_v.en: Indeed Allah knows the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and Allah watches what you do.’

_v.ar: قٓ ۚ وَٱلْقُرْءَانِ ٱلْمَجِيدِ
_v.en: Qaf. By the glorious Quran.

_v.ar: بَلْ عَجِبُوٓا۟ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ فَقَالَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا شَىْءٌ عَجِيبٌ
_v.en: Indeed they consider it odd that a warner from among themselves should have come to them. So the faithless say, ‘This is an odd thing.’

_v.ar: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌۢ بَعِيدٌ
_v.en: ‘What! When we are dead and have become dust, [shall we be raised again]? That is a far-fetched return!’

_v.ar: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنقُصُ ٱلْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِندَنَا كِتَـٰبٌ حَفِيظٌۢ
_v.en: We know what the earth diminishes from them, and with Us is a preserving Book.

_v.ar: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِىٓ أَمْرٍ مَّرِيجٍ
_v.en: Indeed, they denied the truth when it came to them; so they are now in a perplexed state of affairs.

_v.ar: أَفَلَمْ يَنظُرُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَـٰهَا وَزَيَّنَّـٰهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِن فُرُوجٍ
_v.en: Have they not, then, observed the heaven above them, how We have built it and adorned it, and that there are no cracks in it?

_v.ar: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَـٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۭ بَهِيجٍ
_v.en: And We spread out the earth, and cast in it firm mountains, and caused every delightful kind [of vegetation] to grow in it.

_v.ar: تَبْصِرَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ مُّنِيبٍ
_v.en: [In this there is] an insight and admonition for every penitent servant.

_v.ar: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً مُّبَـٰرَكًا فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ جَنَّـٰتٍ وَحَبَّ ٱلْحَصِيدِ
_v.en: We send down from the sky salubrious water, with which We grow gardens and the grain which is harvested,

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَـٰتٍ لَّهَا طَلْعٌ نَّضِيدٌ
_v.en: and tall date palms with regularly set spathes,

_v.ar: رِّزْقًا لِّلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِۦ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْخُرُوجُ
_v.en: as a provision for Our servants, and with it We revive a dead country. Likewise will be the rising [from the dead].

_v.ar: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
_v.en: The people of Noah denied before them, and [so did] the people of Rass and Thamud,

_v.ar: وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَٰنُ لُوطٍ
_v.en: and ‘Ad, Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot,

_v.ar: وَأَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
_v.en: and the inhabitants of Aykah and the people of Tubbac. Each [of them] impugned the apostles, and so My threat became due [against them].

_v.ar: أَفَعَيِينَا بِٱلْخَلْقِ ٱلْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى لَبْسٍ مِّنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
_v.en: Have We been exhausted by the first creation? No, they are in doubt about a new creation.

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِۦ نَفْسُهُۥ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ ٱلْوَرِيدِ
_v.en: Certainly We have created man and We know to what his soul tempts him, and We are nearer to him than his jugular vein.

_v.ar: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى ٱلْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ
_v.en: When the twin recorders record [his deeds], seated on the right hand and on the left:

_v.ar: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ
_v.en: he says no word but that there is a ready observer beside him.

_v.ar: وَجَآءَتْ سَكْرَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
_v.en: The throes of death bring the truth: ‘This is what you used to shun!’

_v.ar: وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْوَعِيدِ
_v.en: And the Trumpet will be blown: ‘This is the promised day.’

_v.ar: وَجَآءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّعَهَا سَآئِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ
_v.en: Every soul will come accompanied by [two angels], a driver, and a witness:

_v.ar: لَّقَدْ كُنتَ فِى غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنكَ غِطَآءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ
_v.en: [he will be told] ‘You were certainly oblivious of this. We have removed your veil from you, and so today your eyesight is acute.’

_v.ar: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ هَـٰذَا مَا لَدَىَّ عَتِيدٌ
_v.en: Then his companion [angel] will say, ‘This is what is ready with me [of his record of deeds].’

_v.ar: أَلْقِيَا فِى جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
_v.en: [The two angels accompany him will be told,] ‘Cast every obdurate ingrate into hell,

_v.ar: مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ مُّرِيبٍ
_v.en: [every] hinderer of good, transgressor, and skeptic,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلشَّدِيدِ
_v.en: who had set up another god along with Allah and cast him into the severe punishment.’

_v.ar: قَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ رَبَّنَا مَآ أَطْغَيْتُهُۥ وَلَـٰكِن كَانَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۭ بَعِيدٍ
_v.en: His companion [devil] will say, ‘Our Lord! I did not incite him to rebel [against You], but he was [himself] in extreme error.’

_v.ar: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا۟ لَدَىَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُم بِٱلْوَعِيدِ
_v.en: He will say, ‘Do not wrangle in My presence, for I had already warned you in advance.

_v.ar: مَا يُبَدَّلُ ٱلْقَوْلُ لَدَىَّ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّـٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
_v.en: The word [of judgement] is unalterable with Me, and I am not tyrannical to My servants.’

_v.ar: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍ
_v.en: The day when We shall say to hell, ‘Are you full?’ It will say, ‘Is there any more?’

_v.ar: وَأُزْلِفَتِ ٱلْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ
_v.en: And paradise will be brought near for the Godwary, it will not be distant [any more]:

_v.ar: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ
_v.en: ‘This is what you were promised. [It is] for every penitent and dutiful [servant]

_v.ar: مَّنْ خَشِىَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنَ بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَجَآءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُّنِيبٍ
_v.en: who fears the All-beneficent in secret and comes with a penitent heart.

_v.ar: ٱدْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَـٰمٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْخُلُودِ
_v.en: Enter it in peace! This is the day of immortality.’

_v.ar: لَهُم مَّا يَشَآءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ
_v.en: There they will have whatever they wish, and with Us there is yet more.

_v.ar: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا۟ فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ هَلْ مِن مَّحِيصٍ
_v.en: How many generations We have destroyed before them, who were stronger than these, insomuch that they ransacked the towns?! So, is there any escape [from Allah’s punishment]?

_v.ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُۥ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى ٱلسَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
_v.en: There is indeed an admonition in that for one who has a heart, or gives ear, being attentive.

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٍ
_v.en: Certainly We created the heavens and the earth, and whatever is between them, in six days, and any fatigue did not touch Us.

_v.ar: فَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ ٱلْغُرُوبِ
_v.en: So be patient at what they say, and celebrate the praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before the sunset,

_v.ar: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَـٰرَ ٱلسُّجُودِ
_v.en: and glorify Him through part of the night and after the prostrations.

_v.ar: وَٱسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ ٱلْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
_v.en: And be on the alert for the day when the caller calls from a close quarter,

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ ٱلصَّيْحَةَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْخُرُوجِ
_v.en: the day when they hear the Cry in all truth. That is the day of rising [from the dead].

_v.ar: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا ٱلْمَصِيرُ
_v.en: Indeed it is We who give life and bring death, and toward Us is the [final] destination.

_v.ar: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ
_v.en: The day the earth is split open for [disentombing] them, [they will come out] hastening. That mustering is easy for Us [to carry out].

_v.ar: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِٱلْقُرْءَانِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
_v.en: We know well what they say, and you are not there to compel them. So admonish by the Quran those who fear My threat.

_v.ar: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَـٰتِ ذَرْوًا
_v.en: By the scattering [winds] that scatter [the clouds];

_v.ar: فَٱلْحَـٰمِلَـٰتِ وِقْرًا
_v.en: by the [rain] bearing [clouds] laden [with water];

_v.ar: فَٱلْجَـٰرِيَـٰتِ يُسْرًا
_v.en: by [the ships] which move gently [on the sea];

_v.ar: فَٱلْمُقَسِّمَـٰتِ أَمْرًا
_v.en: by [the angels] who dispense [livelihood] by [His] command:

_v.ar: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ
_v.en: indeed what you are promised is true,

_v.ar: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٌ
_v.en: and indeed the retribution will surely come to pass!

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْحُبُكِ
_v.en: By the sky full of adornment [with stars],

_v.ar: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِى قَوْلٍ مُّخْتَلِفٍ
_v.en: indeed you are of different opinions!

_v.ar: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ
_v.en: He who has been turned away [from the truth] is turned away from it.

_v.ar: قُتِلَ ٱلْخَرَّٰصُونَ
_v.en: Perish the liars,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِى غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ
_v.en: who are heedless in a stupor!

_v.ar: يَسْـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: They ask, ‘When will be the Day of Retribution?’

_v.ar: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ
_v.en: It is the day when they will be tormented in the Fire,

_v.ar: ذُوقُوا۟ فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
_v.en: [and will be told]: ‘Taste your torment. This is what you used to hasten.’

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
_v.en: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and springs,

_v.ar: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
_v.en: receiving what their Lord has given them, for they had been virtuous aforetime.

_v.ar: كَانُوا۟ قَلِيلًا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
_v.en: They used to sleep a little during the night,

_v.ar: وَبِٱلْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
_v.en: and at dawns they would plead for forgiveness,

_v.ar: وَفِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ
_v.en: and there was a share in their wealth for the beggar and the deprived.

_v.ar: وَفِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ءَايَـٰتٌ لِّلْمُوقِنِينَ
_v.en: In the earth are signs for those who have conviction,

_v.ar: وَفِىٓ أَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
_v.en: and in your souls [as well]. Will you not then perceive?

_v.ar: وَفِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
_v.en: And in the sky is your provision and what you are promised.

_v.ar: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ
_v.en: By the Lord of the sky and the earth, it is indeed the truth, just as [it is a fact that] you speak.

_v.ar: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلْمُكْرَمِينَ
_v.en: Did you receive the story of Abraham’s honoured guests?

_v.ar: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
_v.en: When they entered into his presence, they said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He answered, ‘[You are] an unfamiliar folk.’

_v.ar: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
_v.en: Then he retired to his family and brought a fat [roasted] calf,

_v.ar: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
_v.en: and put it near them. He said, ‘Will you not eat?’

_v.ar: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِيمٍ
_v.en: Then he felt a fear of them. They said, ‘Do not be afraid!’ and they gave him the good news of a wise son.

_v.ar: فَأَقْبَلَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ فِى صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
_v.en: Then his wife came forward crying [with joy]. She beat her face, and said, ‘A barren old woman!’

_v.ar: قَالُوا۟ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
_v.en: They said, ‘So has your Lord said. Indeed He is the All-wise, the All-knowing.’

_v.ar: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
_v.en: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’

_v.ar: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ أُرْسِلْنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
_v.en: They said, ‘We have been sent toward a guilty people,

_v.ar: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن طِينٍ
_v.en: that We may rain upon them stones of clay,

_v.ar: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ
_v.en: sent for the transgressors from your Lord.

_v.ar: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
_v.en: So We picked out those who were in it of the faithful,

_v.ar: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
_v.en: but We did not find there other than one house of Muslims,

_v.ar: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةً لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
_v.en: and We have left therein a sign for those who fear a painful punishment.’

_v.ar: وَفِى مُوسَىٰٓ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
_v.en: And in Moses [too there is a sign] when We sent him to Pharaoh with a manifest authority.

_v.ar: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَـٰحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
_v.en: But he turned away assured of his might, and said, ‘A magician or a crazy man!’

_v.ar: فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
_v.en: So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea, while he was blameworthy.

_v.ar: وَفِى عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلْعَقِيمَ
_v.en: And in ‘Ad when We unleashed upon them a barren wind.

_v.ar: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَىْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ
_v.en: It left nothing that it came upon without making it like decayed bones.

_v.ar: وَفِى ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
_v.en: And in Thamud, when they were told, ‘Enjoy for a while.’

_v.ar: فَعَتَوْا۟ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّـٰعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
_v.en: Then they defied the command of their Lord; so the thunderbolt seized them as they looked on.

_v.ar: فَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ مِن قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُنتَصِرِينَ
_v.en: So they were neither able to rise up, nor to come to one another’s aid.

_v.ar: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا فَـٰسِقِينَ
_v.en: And the people of Noah aforetime. Indeed, they were a transgressing lot.

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيْنَـٰهَا بِأَيْي۟دٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
_v.en: We have built the heaven with might, and indeed it is We who are its expanders.

_v.ar: وَٱلْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَـٰهَا فَنِعْمَ ٱلْمَـٰهِدُونَ
_v.en: And We have spread out the earth, so how excellent spreaders We have been!

_v.ar: وَمِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
_v.en: In all things We have created pairs so that you may take admonition.

_v.ar: فَفِرُّوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّى لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
_v.en: ‘So flee toward Allah. Indeed, I am from Him a manifest warner to you.

_v.ar: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ ۖ إِنِّى لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
_v.en: Do not set up another god besides Allah. Indeed I am from Him a manifest warner to you.’

_v.ar: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا۟ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
_v.en: So it was that there did not come any apostle to those who were before them but they said, ‘A magician,’ or ‘A crazy man!’

_v.ar: أَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِهِۦ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
_v.en: Did they enjoin this upon one another?! Rather, they were a rebellious lot.

_v.ar: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٍ
_v.en: So turn away from them, as you will not be blameworthy.

_v.ar: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
_v.en: And admonish, for admonition indeed benefits the faithful.

_v.ar: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ ٱلْجِنَّ وَٱلْإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ
_v.en: I did not create the jinn and the humans except that they may worship Me.

_v.ar: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنْهُم مِّن رِّزْقٍ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطْعِمُونِ
_v.en: I desire no provision from them, nor do I desire that they should feed Me.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلْقُوَّةِ ٱلْمَتِينُ
_v.en: Indeed it is Allah who is the All-provider, Powerful and All-strong.

_v.ar: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ذَنُوبًا مِّثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَـٰبِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
_v.en: Indeed the lot of those who do wrong [now] will be like the lot of their [earlier] counterparts. So let them not ask Me to hasten on [that fate].

_v.ar: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن يَوْمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
_v.en: Woe to the faithless for the day they are promised!

_v.ar: وَٱلطُّورِ
_v.en: By the Mount [Sinai],

_v.ar: وَكِتَـٰبٍ مَّسْطُورٍ
_v.en: by the Book inscribed

_v.ar: فِى رَقٍّ مَّنشُورٍ
_v.en: on an unrolled parchment;

_v.ar: وَٱلْبَيْتِ ٱلْمَعْمُورِ
_v.en: by the House greatly frequented;

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّقْفِ ٱلْمَرْفُوعِ
_v.en: by the vault raised high,

_v.ar: وَٱلْبَحْرِ ٱلْمَسْجُورِ
_v.en: by the surging sea:

_v.ar: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَٰقِعٌ
_v.en: indeed your Lord’s punishment will surely befall.

_v.ar: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعٍ
_v.en: There is none who can avert it.

_v.ar: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ مَوْرًا
_v.en: On the day when the sky whirls violently,

_v.ar: وَتَسِيرُ ٱلْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا
_v.en: and the mountains move with an awful motion:

_v.ar: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: woe to the deniers on that day

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِى خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ
_v.en: —those who play around in vain talk,

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
_v.en: the day when they will be shoved forcibly toward the fire of hell, [and told:]

_v.ar: هَـٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِى كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
_v.en: ‘This is the Fire which you used to deny!

_v.ar: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَـٰذَآ أَمْ أَنتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
_v.en: Is this, then, [also] magic, or is it you who do not perceive?

_v.ar: ٱصْلَوْهَا فَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
_v.en: Enter it, and it will be the same for you whether you are patient or impatient. You are only being requited for what you used to do.’

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ
_v.en: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and bliss,

_v.ar: فَـٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
_v.en: rejoicing because of what their Lord has given them, and that their Lord has saved them from the punishment of hell.

_v.ar: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
_v.en: [They will be told:] ‘Enjoy your food and drink, [as a reward] for what you used to do.’

_v.ar: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَـٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
_v.en: They will be reclining on arrayed couches, and We will wed them to big-eyed houris.

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَـٰنٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَآ أَلَتْنَـٰهُم مِّنْ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَىْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
_v.en: The faithful and their descendants who followed them in faith—We will make their descendants join them, and We will not stint anything from [the reward of] their deeds. Every person is hostage to what he has earned.

_v.ar: وَأَمْدَدْنَـٰهُم بِفَـٰكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
_v.en: We will provide them with fruits and meat, such as they desire.

_v.ar: يَتَنَـٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
_v.en: There they will pass from hand to hand a cup wherein there will be neither any vain talk nor sinful speech.

_v.ar: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَّهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
_v.en: They will be waited upon by their youths, as if they were guarded pearls.

_v.ar: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
_v.en: They will turn to one another, questioning each other.

_v.ar: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِىٓ أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
_v.en: They will say, ‘Indeed, aforetime, we used to be apprehensive about our families.

_v.ar: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ
_v.en: But Allah showed us favour and He saved us from the punishment of the [infernal] miasma.

_v.ar: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
_v.en: We used to supplicate Him aforetime. Indeed He is the All-benign, the All-merciful.’

_v.ar: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
_v.en: So admonish. By your Lord’s blessing, you are not a soothsayer, nor mad.

_v.ar: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيْبَ ٱلْمَنُونِ
_v.en: Do they say, ‘[He is] a poet, for whom we await a fatal accident’?

_v.ar: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا۟ فَإِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
_v.en: Say, ‘Wait! I too am waiting along with you.’

_v.ar: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَـٰمُهُم بِهَـٰذَآ ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
_v.en: Is it their intellect which prompts them to [say] this, or are they a rebellious lot?

_v.ar: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥ ۚ بَل لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
_v.en: Do they say, ‘He has improvised it [himself]?’ Rather, they have no faith!

_v.ar: فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِحَدِيثٍ مِّثْلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
_v.en: Let them bring a discourse like it, if they are truthful.

_v.ar: أَمْ خُلِقُوا۟ مِنْ غَيْرِ شَىْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰلِقُونَ
_v.en: Were they created from nothing? Or are they [their own] creators?

_v.ar: أَمْ خَلَقُوا۟ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ ۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
_v.en: Did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they have no certainty!

_v.ar: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ ٱلْمُصَۣيْطِرُونَ
_v.en: Do they possess the treasuries of your Lord? Or do they control [them]?

_v.ar: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُم بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
_v.en: Do they have a ladder [leading up to heaven] whereby they eavesdrop? If so, let their eavesdropper produce a manifest authority.

_v.ar: أَمْ لَهُ ٱلْبَنَـٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلْبَنُونَ
_v.en: Does He have daughters while you have sons?

_v.ar: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
_v.en: Do you ask them for a reward, so that they are [wary of] being weighed down with debt?

_v.ar: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
_v.en: Do they have [access to] the Unseen, which they write down?

_v.ar: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْمَكِيدُونَ
_v.en: Do they seek to outmaneuver [Allah]? But it is the faithless who are the outmaneuvered ones!

_v.ar: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
_v.en: Do they have any god other than Allah? Clear is Allah of any partners that they may ascribe [to Him]!

_v.ar: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ كِسْفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا۟ سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ
_v.en: Were they to see a fragment falling from the sky, they would say, ‘A cumulous cloud.’

_v.ar: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
_v.en: So leave them until they encounter the day when they will be thunderstruck,

_v.ar: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
_v.en: the day when their guile will not avail them in any way, nor will they be helped.

_v.ar: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: Indeed there is a punishment besides that for those who do wrong, but most of them do not know.

_v.ar: وَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
_v.en: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord, for indeed you fare before Our eyes. And celebrate the praise of your Lord when you rise [at dawn],

_v.ar: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَـٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
_v.en: and also glorify Him during the night and at the receding of the stars.

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ
_v.en: By the star when it sets:

_v.ar: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَمَا غَوَىٰ
_v.en: your companion has neither gone astray, nor amiss.

_v.ar: وَمَا يَنطِقُ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰٓ
_v.en: Nor does he speak out of [his own] desire:

_v.ar: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحْىٌ يُوحَىٰ
_v.en: it is just a revelation that is revealed [to him],

_v.ar: عَلَّمَهُۥ شَدِيدُ ٱلْقُوَىٰ
_v.en: taught him by one of great powers,

_v.ar: ذُو مِرَّةٍ فَٱسْتَوَىٰ
_v.en: possessed of sound judgement. He settled,

_v.ar: وَهُوَ بِٱلْأُفُقِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
_v.en: while he was on the highest horizon.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ
_v.en: Then he drew nearer and nearer

_v.ar: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ
_v.en: until he was within two bows’ length or even nearer,

_v.ar: فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ عَبْدِهِۦ مَآ أَوْحَىٰ
_v.en: whereat He revealed to His servant whatever He revealed.

_v.ar: مَا كَذَبَ ٱلْفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰٓ
_v.en: The heart did not deny what it saw.

_v.ar: أَفَتُمَـٰرُونَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ
_v.en: Will you then dispute with him about what he saw?!

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ رَءَاهُ نَزْلَةً أُخْرَىٰ
_v.en: Certainly he saw it yet another time,

_v.ar: عِندَ سِدْرَةِ ٱلْمُنتَهَىٰ
_v.en: by the Lote Tree of the Ultimate Boundary,

_v.ar: عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰٓ
_v.en: near which is the Garden of the Abode,

_v.ar: إِذْ يَغْشَى ٱلسِّدْرَةَ مَا يَغْشَىٰ
_v.en: when there covered the Lote Tree what covered it.

_v.ar: مَا زَاغَ ٱلْبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ
_v.en: His gaze did not swerve, nor did it overstep the bounds.

_v.ar: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰٓ
_v.en: Certainly he saw some of the greatest signs of his Lord.

_v.ar: أَفَرَءَيْتُمُ ٱللَّـٰتَ وَٱلْعُزَّىٰ
_v.en: Have you considered Lat and ‘Uzza?

_v.ar: وَمَنَوٰةَ ٱلثَّالِثَةَ ٱلْأُخْرَىٰٓ
_v.en: and Manat, the third one?

_v.ar: أَلَكُمُ ٱلذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ ٱلْأُنثَىٰ
_v.en: Are you to have males and He females?

_v.ar: تِلْكَ إِذًا قِسْمَةٌ ضِيزَىٰٓ
_v.en: That, then, will be an unfair division!

_v.ar: إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّآ أَسْمَآءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَـٰنٍ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى ٱلْأَنفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
_v.en: These are but names, which you have coined—you and your fathers—for which Allah has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjectures and the desires of the [lower] soul, while there has already come to them the guidance from their Lord.

_v.ar: أَمْ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ
_v.en: Shall man have whatever he yearns for?

_v.ar: فَلِلَّهِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ وَٱلْأُولَىٰ
_v.en: Yet to Allah belong this world and the Hereafter.

_v.ar: وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغْنِى شَفَـٰعَتُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَن يَأْذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرْضَىٰٓ
_v.en: How many an angel there is in the heavens whose intercession is of not any avail, except after Allah permits whomever He wishes and approves of!

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ ٱلْأُنثَىٰ
_v.en: Indeed those who do not believe in the Hereafter give female names to the angels.

_v.ar: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ شَيْـًٔا
_v.en: They do not have any knowledge of that. They follow nothing but conjectures, and conjecture is no substitute for the truth.

_v.ar: فَأَعْرِضْ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
_v.en: So avoid those who turn away from Our remembrance and desire nothing but the life of the world.

_v.ar: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
_v.en: That is the ultimate reach of their knowledge. Indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are [rightly] guided.

_v.ar: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَـٰٓـُٔوا۟ بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ بِٱلْحُسْنَى
_v.en: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, that He may requite those who do evil for what they have done, and reward those who do good with the best [of rewards].

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَـٰٓئِرَ ٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِى بُطُونِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
_v.en: Those who avoid major sins and indecencies, apart from [minor and occasional] lapses. Indeed your Lord is expansive in [His] forgiveness. He knows you best since [the time] He produced you from the earth and since you were foetuses in the bellies of your mothers. So do not flaunt your piety: He knows best those who are Godwary.

_v.ar: أَفَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى تَوَلَّىٰ
_v.en: Did you see him who turned away,

_v.ar: وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًا وَأَكْدَىٰٓ
_v.en: gave a little and held off?

_v.ar: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰٓ
_v.en: Does he have the knowledge of the Unseen so that he sees?

_v.ar: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِى صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
_v.en: Has he not been informed of what is in the scriptures of Moses,

_v.ar: وَإِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلَّذِى وَفَّىٰٓ
_v.en: and of Abraham, who fulfilled [his summons]:

_v.ar: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ
_v.en: that no bearer shall bear another’s burden,

_v.ar: وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
_v.en: that nothing belongs to man except what he strives for,

_v.ar: وَأَنَّ سَعْيَهُۥ سَوْفَ يُرَىٰ
_v.en: and that he will soon be shown his endeavour,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ يُجْزَىٰهُ ٱلْجَزَآءَ ٱلْأَوْفَىٰ
_v.en: then he will be rewarded for it with the fullest reward;

_v.ar: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلْمُنتَهَىٰ
_v.en: that the terminus is toward your Lord,

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضْحَكَ وَأَبْكَىٰ
_v.en: that it is He who makes [men] laugh, and weep,

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا
_v.en: that it is He who brings death and gives life,

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوْجَيْنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰ
_v.en: that it is He who created the mates, the male and the female,

_v.ar: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ
_v.en: from a drop of [seminal] fluid when emitted;

_v.ar: وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْأُخْرَىٰ
_v.en: that with Him lies the second genesis,

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغْنَىٰ وَأَقْنَىٰ
_v.en: that it is He who enriches and grants possessions,

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعْرَىٰ
_v.en: that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius;

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥٓ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا ٱلْأُولَىٰ
_v.en: that it is He who destroyed the former ‘Ad,

_v.ar: وَثَمُودَا۟ فَمَآ أَبْقَىٰ
_v.en: and Thamud, sparing none [of them];

_v.ar: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
_v.en: and the people of Noah before that; indeed they were more unjust and rebellious;

_v.ar: وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ
_v.en: and He overthrew the town that was overturned,

_v.ar: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
_v.en: covering it with what covered it.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ
_v.en: Then which of the bounties of your Lord will you dispute?

_v.ar: هَـٰذَا نَذِيرٌ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلْأُولَىٰٓ
_v.en: This is a warner, [in the tradition] of the warners of old.

_v.ar: أَزِفَتِ ٱلْـَٔازِفَةُ
_v.en: The Imminent [Hour] is near at hand.

_v.ar: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
_v.en: There is none who may unveil it besides Allah.

_v.ar: أَفَمِنْ هَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ
_v.en: Will you then wonder at this discourse,

_v.ar: وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ
_v.en: and laugh and not weep,

_v.ar: وَأَنتُمْ سَـٰمِدُونَ
_v.en: while you remain heedless?!

_v.ar: فَٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ وَٱعْبُدُوا۟ ۩
_v.en: So prostrate yourselves to Allah and worship Him!

_v.ar: ٱقْتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلْقَمَرُ
_v.en: The Hour has drawn near and the moon is split.

_v.ar: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ ءَايَةً يُعْرِضُوا۟ وَيَقُولُوا۟ سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ
_v.en: If they see a sign, they turn away, and say, ‘An incessant magic!’

_v.ar: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
_v.en: They denied and followed their own desires, and every matter has a setting [appropriate to it].

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
_v.en: There have already come to them reports containing admonishment,

_v.ar: حِكْمَةٌۢ بَـٰلِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ
_v.en: [and representing] far-reaching wisdom; but warnings are of no avail!

_v.ar: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَىْءٍ نُّكُرٍ
_v.en: So turn away from them! The day when the Caller calls to a dire thing,

_v.ar: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ
_v.en: they will emerge from the graves as if they were scattered locusts with a humbled look [in their eyes],

_v.ar: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
_v.en: scrambling toward the summoner. The faithless will say, ‘This is a hard day!’

_v.ar: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا۟ عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا۟ مَجْنُونٌ وَٱزْدُجِرَ
_v.en: The people of Noah impugned before them. So they impugned Our servant and said, ‘A crazy man,’ and he was reviled.

_v.ar: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَغْلُوبٌ فَٱنتَصِرْ
_v.en: Thereat he invoked his Lord, [saying,] ‘I have been overcome, so help [me].’

_v.ar: فَفَتَحْنَآ أَبْوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٍ مُّنْهَمِرٍ
_v.en: Then We opened the gates of the sky with pouring waters,

_v.ar: وَفَجَّرْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَٱلْتَقَى ٱلْمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
_v.en: and We made the earth burst forth with springs, and the waters met for a preordained purpose.

_v.ar: وَحَمَلْنَـٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَٰحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
_v.en: We bore him on a vessel made of planks and nails,

_v.ar: تَجْرِى بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَآءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
_v.en: which sailed [over the flood waters] in Our sight, as a retribution for him who was met with disbelief.

_v.ar: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَـٰهَآ ءَايَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
_v.en: Certainly We have left it as a sign; so is there anyone who will be admonished?

_v.ar: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
_v.en: So how were My punishment and warnings?

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
_v.en: Certainly We have made the Quran simple for the sake of admonishment. So is there anyone who will be admonished?

_v.ar: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
_v.en: [The people of] ‘Ad impugned [their apostle]. So how were My punishment and warnings?

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِى يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ
_v.en: Indeed We unleashed upon them an icy gale on an incessantly ill-fated day,

_v.ar: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ
_v.en: knocking down people as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.

_v.ar: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
_v.en: So how were My punishment and warnings?!

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
_v.en: Certainly We have made the Quran simple for the sake of admonishment. So is there anyone who will be admonished?

_v.ar: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
_v.en: [The people of] Thamud denied the warnings,

_v.ar: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرًا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدًا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
_v.en: and they said, ‘Are we to follow a lone human from ourselves?! Indeed then we would be in error and madness.’

_v.ar: أَءُلْقِىَ ٱلذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
_v.en: ‘Has the Reminder been cast upon him from among us? No, he is a self-conceited liar.’

_v.ar: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَّنِ ٱلْكَذَّابُ ٱلْأَشِرُ
_v.en: ‘Tomorrow they will know who is a self-conceited liar.

_v.ar: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَّهُمْ فَٱرْتَقِبْهُمْ وَٱصْطَبِرْ
_v.en: We are sending the She-camel as a trial for them; so watch them and be steadfast.

_v.ar: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلْمَآءَ قِسْمَةٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُّحْتَضَرٌ
_v.en: Inform them that the water is to be shared between them; each of them showing up at his turn.’

_v.ar: فَنَادَوْا۟ صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
_v.en: But they called their companion, and he took [a knife] and hamstrung [her].

_v.ar: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
_v.en: So how were My punishment and My warnings?!

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلْمُحْتَظِرِ
_v.en: We sent against them a single Cry, and they became like the dry sticks of a corral builder.

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
_v.en: Certainly We have made the Quran simple for the sake of admonishment. So is there anyone who will be admonished?

_v.ar: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
_v.en: And the people of Lot denied the warnings.

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَـٰهُم بِسَحَرٍ
_v.en: We unleashed upon them a rain of stones, excepting the family of Lot, whom We delivered at dawn

_v.ar: نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَن شَكَرَ
_v.en: as a blessing from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا۟ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
_v.en: He had already warned them of Our punishment, but they disputed the warnings.

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِۦ فَطَمَسْنَآ أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
_v.en: They even solicited of him his guests, whereat We blotted out their eyes, [saying,] ‘Taste My punishment and My warnings!’

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
_v.en: Early at dawn there visited them an abiding punishment:

_v.ar: فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
_v.en: ‘Taste My punishment and warnings!’

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
_v.en: Certainly We have made the Quran simple for the sake of admonishment. So is there anyone who will be admonished?

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
_v.en: Certainly the warnings did come to Pharaoh’s clan

_v.ar: كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
_v.en: who denied all of Our signs. So We seized them with the seizing of One [who is] all-mighty, Omnipotent.

_v.ar: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٌ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
_v.en: Are your faithless better than those? Have you [been granted] [some sort of] immunity in the scriptures?

_v.ar: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُّنتَصِرٌ
_v.en: Do they say, ‘We are a confederate league’?

_v.ar: سَيُهْزَمُ ٱلْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
_v.en: The league will be routed and turn its back [to flee].

_v.ar: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
_v.en: Indeed, the Hour is their tryst; and the Hour will be most calamitous and bitter.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
_v.en: Indeed the guilty are steeped in error and madness.

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا۟ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
_v.en: The day when they are dragged on their faces into the Fire, [it will be said to them,] ‘Taste the touch of hell!’

_v.ar: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ بِقَدَرٍ
_v.en: Indeed We have created everything in a measure,

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَمْرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍۭ بِٱلْبَصَرِ
_v.en: and Our command is but a single [word], like the twinkling of an eye.

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَآ أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
_v.en: Certainly We have destroyed your likes. So is there anyone who will be admonished?

_v.ar: وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
_v.en: Everything they have done is in the books,

_v.ar: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُّسْتَطَرٌ
_v.en: and everything big and small is committed to writing.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
_v.en: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and streams,

_v.ar: فِى مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍۭ
_v.en: in the abode of truthfulness with an omnipotent King.

_v.ar: ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ
_v.en: The All-beneficent

_v.ar: عَلَّمَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ
_v.en: has taught the Quran.

_v.ar: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ
_v.en: He created man,

_v.ar: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلْبَيَانَ
_v.en: [and] taught him articulate speech.

_v.ar: ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍ
_v.en: The sun and the moon are [disposed] calculatedly,

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّجْمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ
_v.en: and the herb and the tree prostrate [to Allah].

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلْمِيزَانَ
_v.en: He raised the heaven high and set up the balance,

_v.ar: أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْمِيزَانِ
_v.en: declaring, ‘Do not infringe the balance!

_v.ar: وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلْوَزْنَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا۟ ٱلْمِيزَانَ
_v.en: Maintain the weights with justice, and do not shorten the balance!’

_v.ar: وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ
_v.en: And the earth—He laid it out for mankind.

_v.ar: فِيهَا فَـٰكِهَةٌ وَٱلنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ ٱلْأَكْمَامِ
_v.en: In it are fruits and date-palms with sheaths,

_v.ar: وَٱلْحَبُّ ذُو ٱلْعَصْفِ وَٱلرَّيْحَانُ
_v.en: grain with husk, and fragrant herbs.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍ كَٱلْفَخَّارِ
_v.en: He created man out of dry clay, like the potter’s,

_v.ar: وَخَلَقَ ٱلْجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٍ مِّن نَّارٍ
_v.en: and created the jinn out of a flame of a fire.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَغْرِبَيْنِ
_v.en: Lord of the two easts, and Lord of the two wests!

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: مَرَجَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ
_v.en: He merged the two seas, meeting each other.

_v.ar: بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَّا يَبْغِيَانِ
_v.en: There is a barrier between them, which they do not overstep.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا ٱللُّؤْلُؤُ وَٱلْمَرْجَانُ
_v.en: From them emerge the pearl and the coral.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: وَلَهُ ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ كَٱلْأَعْلَـٰمِ
_v.en: His are the sailing ships on the sea [appearing] like landmarks.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍ
_v.en: Everyone on it is ephemeral,

_v.ar: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلْجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلْإِكْرَامِ
_v.en: yet lasting is the majestic and munificent Face of your Lord.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: يَسْـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِى شَأْنٍ
_v.en: Everyone in the heavens and the earth asks Him. Every day He is engaged in some work.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ
_v.en: Soon We shall make Ourselves unoccupied for you, O you notable two!

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: يَـٰمَعْشَرَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَن تَنفُذُوا۟ مِنْ أَقْطَارِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنفُذُوا۟ ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ
_v.en: O company of jinn and humans! If you can pass through the confines of the heavens and the earth, then do pass through. But you will not pass through except by an authority [from Allah].

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِّن نَّارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
_v.en: There will be unleashed upon you a flash of fire and a smoke; then you will not be able to help one another.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَٱلدِّهَانِ
_v.en: When the sky is split open, and turns crimson like tanned leather.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُسْـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٌ وَلَا جَآنٌّ
_v.en: On that day neither humans will be questioned about their sins nor jinn.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: يُعْرَفُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَـٰهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِى وَٱلْأَقْدَامِ
_v.en: The guilty will be recognized by their mark; so they will be seized by their forelocks and feet.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: هَـٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِى يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
_v.en: ‘This is the hell which the guilty would deny!’

_v.ar: يَطُوفُونَ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ حَمِيمٍ ءَانٍ
_v.en: They shall circuit between it and boiling hot water.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: وَلِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ
_v.en: For him who stands in awe of his Lord will be two gardens.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: ذَوَاتَآ أَفْنَانٍ
_v.en: Both abounding in branches.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ تَجْرِيَانِ
_v.en: In both of them will be two flowing springs.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَـٰكِهَةٍ زَوْجَانِ
_v.en: In both of them will be two kinds of every fruit.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ ۚ وَجَنَى ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ
_v.en: [They will be] reclining on beds lined with green silk. And the fruit of the two gardens will be near at hand.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فِيهِنَّ قَـٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّ
_v.en: In them are maidens of restrained glances, whom no human has touched before, nor jinn.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلْيَاقُوتُ وَٱلْمَرْجَانُ
_v.en: As though they were rubies and corals.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: هَلْ جَزَآءُ ٱلْإِحْسَـٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلْإِحْسَـٰنُ
_v.en: Is the requital of goodness anything but goodness?

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ
_v.en: Beside these two, there will be two [other] gardens.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: مُدْهَآمَّتَانِ
_v.en: Dark green.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ
_v.en: In both of them will be two gushing springs.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فِيهِمَا فَـٰكِهَةٌ وَنَخْلٌ وَرُمَّانٌ
_v.en: In both of them will be fruits, date-palms and pomegranates.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: فِيهِنَّ خَيْرَٰتٌ حِسَانٌ
_v.en: In them are maidens good and lovely.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: حُورٌ مَّقْصُورَٰتٌ فِى ٱلْخِيَامِ
_v.en: Houris secluded in pavilions.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?

_v.ar: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّ
_v.en: Whom no human has touched before, nor jinn.

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
_v.en: So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?
