_v.ar: وَأَسِرُّوا۟ قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ ٱجْهَرُوا۟ بِهِۦٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
_v.en: Speak secretly, or do so openly, indeed He knows well what is in the breasts.

_v.ar: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ ٱللَّطِيفُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ
_v.en: Would He who has created not know? And He is the All-attentive, the All-aware.

_v.ar: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَٱمْشُوا۟ فِى مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا۟ مِن رِّزْقِهِۦ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ ٱلنُّشُورُ
_v.en: It is He who made the earth tractable for you; so walk on its flanks and eat of His provision, and towards Him is the resurrection.

_v.ar: ءَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَمُورُ
_v.en: Are you secure that He who is in the sky will not make the earth swallow you while it quakes?

_v.ar: أَمْ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ
_v.en: Are you secure that He who is in the sky will not unleash upon you a rain of stones? Soon you will know how My warning has been!

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
_v.en: Certainly those who were before them had impugned [My apostles]; but then how was My rebuttal!

_v.ar: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَـٰٓفَّـٰتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ ۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍۭ بَصِيرٌ
_v.en: Have they not regarded the birds above them spreading and closing their wings? No one sustains them except the All-beneficent. Indeed, He watches all things.

_v.ar: أَمَّنْ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى هُوَ جُندٌ لَّكُمْ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۚ إِنِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ إِلَّا فِى غُرُورٍ
_v.en: Who is it that is your host who may help you, besides the All-beneficent? The faithless only dwell in delusion.

_v.ar: أَمَّنْ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُۥ ۚ بَل لَّجُّوا۟ فِى عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ
_v.en: Who is it that may provide for you if He withholds His provision? Indeed, they persist in defiance and aversion.

_v.ar: أَفَمَن يَمْشِى مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦٓ أَهْدَىٰٓ أَمَّن يَمْشِى سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
_v.en: Is he who walks prone on his face better guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path?

_v.ar: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
_v.en: Say, ‘It is He who created you, and made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts. Little do you thank.’

_v.ar: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلَّذِى ذَرَأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
_v.en: Say, ‘It is He who created you on the earth, and toward Him you will be mustered.’

_v.ar: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
_v.en: They say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?’

_v.ar: قُلْ إِنَّمَا ٱلْعِلْمُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
_v.en: Say, ‘Its knowledge is only with Allah; I am only a manifest warner.’

_v.ar: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيٓـَٔتْ وُجُوهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَقِيلَ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَدَّعُونَ
_v.en: When they see it brought near, the countenances of the faithless will be contorted, and [they will be] told, ‘This is what you were asking for!’

_v.ar: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِىَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِىَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
_v.en: Say, ‘Tell me, whether Allah destroys me and those who are with me, or He has mercy on us, who will shelter the faithless from a painful punishment?’

_v.ar: قُلْ هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
_v.en: Say, ‘He is the All-beneficent; we have faith in Him, and in Him do we trust. Soon you will know who is in manifest error.’

_v.ar: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَآؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَآءٍ مَّعِينٍۭ
_v.en: Say, ‘Tell me, should your water sink down [into the ground], who will bring you running water?’

_v.ar: نٓ ۚ وَٱلْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
_v.en: Nun. By the Pen and what they write:

_v.ar: مَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ
_v.en: by your Lord’s blessing, you are not, crazy,

_v.ar: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ
_v.en: and yours indeed will be an everlasting reward,

_v.ar: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ
_v.en: and indeed you possess a great character.

_v.ar: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ
_v.en: You will see and they will see,

_v.ar: بِأَييِّكُمُ ٱلْمَفْتُونُ
_v.en: which one of you is crazy.

_v.ar: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
_v.en: Indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are guided.

_v.ar: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: So do not obey the deniers,

_v.ar: وَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ
_v.en: who are eager that you should be flexible, so that they [too] may be flexible [towards you].

_v.ar: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَّهِينٍ
_v.en: And do not obey any vile swearer,

_v.ar: هَمَّازٍ مَّشَّآءٍۭ بِنَمِيمٍ
_v.en: scandal-monger, talebearer,

_v.ar: مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
_v.en: hinderer of all good, sinful transgressor,

_v.ar: عُتُلٍّۭ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ زَنِيمٍ
_v.en: callous and, on top of that, baseborn

_v.ar: أَن كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ
_v.en: —[who behaves in such a manner only] because he has wealth and children.

_v.ar: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
_v.en: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’

_v.ar: سَنَسِمُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلْخُرْطُومِ
_v.en: Soon We shall brand him on his snout.

_v.ar: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
_v.en: Indeed we have tested them just as We tested the People of the Garden when they vowed they would gather its fruit at dawn,

_v.ar: وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ
_v.en: and they did not make any exception.

_v.ar: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
_v.en: Then, a visitation from your Lord visited it while they were asleep.

_v.ar: فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَٱلصَّرِيمِ
_v.en: So, by dawn it was like a harvested field.

_v.ar: فَتَنَادَوْا۟ مُصْبِحِينَ
_v.en: At dawn they called out to one another,

_v.ar: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
_v.en: ‘Get off early to your field if you have to gather [the fruits].’

_v.ar: فَٱنطَلَقُوا۟ وَهُمْ يَتَخَـٰفَتُونَ
_v.en: So off they went, murmuring to one another:

_v.ar: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
_v.en: ‘Today no needy man shall come to you in it.’

_v.ar: وَغَدَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَـٰدِرِينَ
_v.en: And they set out at early morning, [considering themselves] able to deprive [the poor of its fruit].

_v.ar: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا لَضَآلُّونَ
_v.en: But when they saw it, they said, ‘We have indeed lost our way!’

_v.ar: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ
_v.en: ‘No, it is we who have been deprived!’

_v.ar: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
_v.en: The most upright among them said, ‘Did I not tell you, ‘‘Why do you not glorify [Allah]?’’ ’

_v.ar: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
_v.en: They said, ‘Immaculate is our Lord! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’

_v.ar: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَـٰوَمُونَ
_v.en: Then they turned to one another, blaming each other.

_v.ar: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا طَـٰغِينَ
_v.en: They said, ‘Woe to us! Indeed, we have been rebellious.

_v.ar: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
_v.en: Maybe our Lord will give us a better one in its place. Indeed we earnestly beseech our Lord.’

_v.ar: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: Such was their punishment; and the punishment of the Hereafter is surely greater, had they known.

_v.ar: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
_v.en: Indeed for the Godwary there will be gardens of bliss near their Lord.

_v.ar: أَفَنَجْعَلُ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ كَٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
_v.en: Shall We treat those who submit [to Us] as [We treat] the guilty?

_v.ar: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
_v.en: What is the matter with you? How do you judge!

_v.ar: أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَـٰبٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ
_v.en: Do you possess a scripture in which you read

_v.ar: إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ
_v.en: that you shall have in it whatever you choose?

_v.ar: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
_v.en: Do you have a pledge binding on Us until the Day of Resurrection, that you shall indeed have whatever you decide?

_v.ar: سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُم بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ
_v.en: Ask them, which of them will aver [any of] that!

_v.ar: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
_v.en: Do they have any ‘partners’ [that they claim for Allah]? Then let them produce their partners, if they are truthful.

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
_v.en: The day when the catastrophe occurs and they are summoned to prostrate themselves, they will not be able [to do it].

_v.ar: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
_v.en: With a humbled look [in their eyes], they will be overcast by abasement. Certainly, they were summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet sound.

_v.ar: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: So leave Me with those who deny this discourse. We will draw them imperceptibly [into ruin], whence they do not know.

_v.ar: وَأُمْلِى لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِى مَتِينٌ
_v.en: I will grant them respite, for My devising is indeed sure.

_v.ar: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
_v.en: Do you ask them for a reward, so that they are weighed down with debt?

_v.ar: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
_v.en: Do they possess [access to] the Unseen, so that they write it down?

_v.ar: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
_v.en: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like the Man of the Fish who called out as he choked with grief.

_v.ar: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
_v.en: Had it not been for a blessing that came to his rescue from his Lord, he would surely have been cast on the bare shore, being blameworthy.

_v.ar: فَٱجْتَبَـٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَجَعَلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
_v.en: So his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.

_v.ar: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
_v.en: Indeed the faithless almost devour you with their eyes when they hear this Reminder, and they say, ‘He is indeed crazy.’

_v.ar: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
_v.en: Yet it is just a reminder for all the nations.

_v.ar: ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
_v.en: The Besieger!

_v.ar: مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
_v.en: What is the Besieger?!

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
_v.en: What will show you what is the Besieger?!

_v.ar: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌۢ بِٱلْقَارِعَةِ
_v.en: Thamudand ‘Ad denied the Cataclysm.

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ
_v.en: As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the Cry.

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
_v.en: And as for ‘Ad, they were destroyed by a fierce icy gale,

_v.ar: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
_v.en: which He clamped on them for seven gruelling nights and eight days, so that you could see the people there lying about prostrate as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

_v.ar: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٍ
_v.en: So do you see any remaining trace of them?

_v.ar: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
_v.en: Then Pharaoh and those who were before him, and the towns that were overturned, brought about iniquity.

_v.ar: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
_v.en: They disobeyed the apostle of their Lord, so He seized them with a terrible seizing.

_v.ar: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ
_v.en: Indeed when the Flood rose high, We carried you in a floating ark,

_v.ar: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٰعِيَةٌ
_v.en: that We might make it a reminder for you, and that receptive ears might remember it.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
_v.en: When the Trumpet is blown with a single blast

_v.ar: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٰحِدَةً
_v.en: and the earth and the mountains are lifted and levelled with a single levelling,

_v.ar: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ ٱلْوَاقِعَةُ
_v.en: then, on that day, will the Imminent [Hour] befall

_v.ar: وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَهِىَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ
_v.en: and the sky will be split open—for it will be frail on that day—

_v.ar: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَـٰنِيَةٌ
_v.en: with the angels all over it, and the Throne of your Lord will be borne that day by eight [angels].

_v.ar: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
_v.en: That day you will be presented [before your Lord]: none of your secrets will remain hidden.

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُوا۟ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
_v.en: As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say, ‘Here, take and read my book!

_v.ar: إِنِّى ظَنَنتُ أَنِّى مُلَـٰقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ
_v.en: Indeed I knew that I will encounter my account [of deeds].’

_v.ar: فَهُوَ فِى عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ
_v.en: So he will have a pleasant life,

_v.ar: فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
_v.en: in an elevated garden,

_v.ar: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ
_v.en: whose clusters [of fruits] will be within easy reach.

_v.ar: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ
_v.en: [He will be told]: ‘Enjoy your food and drink, for what you had sent in advance in past days [for your future life].’

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ
_v.en: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, ‘I wish I had not been given my book,

_v.ar: وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ
_v.en: nor had I ever known what my account is!

_v.ar: يَـٰلَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلْقَاضِيَةَ
_v.en: I wish death had been the end of it all!

_v.ar: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّى مَالِيَهْ ۜ
_v.en: My wealth did not avail me.

_v.ar: هَلَكَ عَنِّى سُلْطَـٰنِيَهْ
_v.en: My authority has left me.’

_v.ar: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ
_v.en: [The angels will be told:] ‘Seize him, and fetter him!

_v.ar: ثُمَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ
_v.en: Then put him into hell.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ
_v.en: Then bind him in a chain, seventy cubits in length.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
_v.en: Indeed he had no faith in Allah, the All-supreme,

_v.ar: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
_v.en: and he did not urge the feeding of the needy,

_v.ar: فَلَيْسَ لَهُ ٱلْيَوْمَ هَـٰهُنَا حَمِيمٌ
_v.en: so he has no friend here today,

_v.ar: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ
_v.en: nor any food except pus,

_v.ar: لَّا يَأْكُلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْخَـٰطِـُٔونَ
_v.en: which no one shall eat except the iniquitous.’

_v.ar: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ
_v.en: I swear by what you see

_v.ar: وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
_v.en: and what you do not see:

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
_v.en: it is indeed the speech of a noble apostle

_v.ar: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ
_v.en: and it is not the speech of a poet. Little is the faith that you have!

_v.ar: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
_v.en: Nor is it the speech of a soothsayer. Little is the admonition that you take!

_v.ar: تَنزِيلٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
_v.en: Gradually sent down from the Lord of all the worlds.

_v.ar: وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ ٱلْأَقَاوِيلِ
_v.en: Had he faked any sayings in Our name,

_v.ar: لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِٱلْيَمِينِ
_v.en: We would have surely seized him by the right hand

_v.ar: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ ٱلْوَتِينَ
_v.en: and then cut off his aorta,

_v.ar: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَـٰجِزِينَ
_v.en: and none of you could have held Us off from him.

_v.ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذْكِرَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
_v.en: Indeed it is a reminder for the Godwary.

_v.ar: وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Indeed We know that there are some among you who deny [it].

_v.ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
_v.en: And indeed it will be a [matter of] regret for the faithless.

_v.ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلْيَقِينِ
_v.en: It is indeed certain truth.

_v.ar: فَسَبِّحْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
_v.en: So celebrate the Name of your Lord, the All-supreme.

_v.ar: سَأَلَ سَآئِلٌۢ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ
_v.en: An asker asked for a punishment sure to befall

_v.ar: لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعٌ
_v.en: —which none can avert from the faithless —

_v.ar: مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِى ٱلْمَعَارِجِ
_v.en: from Allah, Lord of the lofty stations.

_v.ar: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
_v.en: The angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in a day whose span is fifty thousand years.

_v.ar: فَٱصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا
_v.en: So be patient, with a patience that is graceful.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُۥ بَعِيدًا
_v.en: Indeed they see it to be far off,

_v.ar: وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِيبًا
_v.en: and We see it to be near.

_v.ar: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ كَٱلْمُهْلِ
_v.en: The day when the sky will be like molten copper,

_v.ar: وَتَكُونُ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَٱلْعِهْنِ
_v.en: and the mountains like [tufts of] dyed wool,

_v.ar: وَلَا يَسْـَٔلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا
_v.en: and no friend will inquire about [the welfare of his] friend,

_v.ar: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِى مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍۭ بِبَنِيهِ
_v.en: [though] they will be placed within each other’s sight. The guilty one will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that day at the price of his children,

_v.ar: وَصَـٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَأَخِيهِ
_v.en: his spouse and his brother,

_v.ar: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ ٱلَّتِى تُـْٔوِيهِ
_v.en: his kin, which had sheltered him

_v.ar: وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
_v.en: and all those who are upon the earth, if that might deliver him.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ
_v.en: Never! Indeed, it is a blazing fire,

_v.ar: نَزَّاعَةً لِّلشَّوَىٰ
_v.en: which strips away the scalp.

_v.ar: تَدْعُوا۟ مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
_v.en: It invites him, who has turned back [from the truth] and forsaken [it],

_v.ar: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوْعَىٰٓ
_v.en: amassing [wealth] and hoarding [it].

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا
_v.en: Indeed man has been created covetous:

_v.ar: إِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلشَّرُّ جَزُوعًا
_v.en: anxious when an ill befalls him

_v.ar: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا
_v.en: and grudging [charity] when good comes his way

_v.ar: إِلَّا ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ
_v.en: —[all are such] except the prayerful,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَآئِمُونَ
_v.en: those who persevere in their prayers

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ فِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ حَقٌّ مَّعْلُومٌ
_v.en: and there is a known share in whose wealth

_v.ar: لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ
_v.en: for the beggar and the deprived,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: and who affirm the Day of Retribution,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
_v.en: and those who are apprehensive of the punishment of their Lord

_v.ar: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍ
_v.en: (there is indeed no security from the punishment of their Lord)

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَـٰفِظُونَ
_v.en: and those who guard their private parts

_v.ar: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
_v.en: (apart from their spouses and their slave women, for then they are not blameworthy;

_v.ar: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
_v.en: but whoever seeks beyond that—it is they who are the transgressors)

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَـٰنَـٰتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَٰعُونَ
_v.en: and those who keep their trusts and covenants,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَـٰدَٰتِهِمْ قَآئِمُونَ
_v.en: and those who are observant of their testimonies,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
_v.en: and those who are watchful of their prayers.

_v.ar: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ مُّكْرَمُونَ
_v.en: They will be in gardens, held in honour.

_v.ar: فَمَالِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ
_v.en: What is the matter with the faithless that they scramble toward you,

_v.ar: عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ
_v.en: from left and right, in groups?

_v.ar: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
_v.en: Does each man among them hope to enter the garden of bliss?

_v.ar: كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُم مِّمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: Never! Indeed, We created them from what they know.

_v.ar: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ وَٱلْمَغَـٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
_v.en: So I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that We are able

_v.ar: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
_v.en: to replace them with [others] better than them and We are not to be outmaneuvered.

_v.ar: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
_v.en: So leave them to gossip and play till they encounter the day they are promised:

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
_v.en: the day when they emerge from graves, hastening, as if racing toward a target,

_v.ar: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلَّذِى كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ
_v.en: with a humbled look [in their eyes], overcast by abasement. That is the day they had been promised.

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
_v.en: Indeed We sent Noah to his people, [saying,] ‘Warn your people before a painful punishment overtakes them.’

_v.ar: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
_v.en: He said, ‘O my people! Indeed, I am a manifest warner to you.

_v.ar: أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
_v.en: Worship Allah and be wary of Him, and obey me,

_v.ar: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: that He may forgive you some of your sins and respite you until a specified time. Indeed when Allah’s [appointed] time comes, it cannot be deferred, if you know.’

_v.ar: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
_v.en: He said, ‘My Lord! Indeed, I have summoned my people night and day

_v.ar: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًا
_v.en: but my summons only increases their evasion.

_v.ar: وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَـٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًا
_v.en: Indeed whenever I have summoned them, so that You might forgive them, they would put their fingers into their ears and draw their cloaks over their heads, and they were persistent [in their unfaith], and disdainful in [their] arrogance.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
_v.en: Again I summoned them aloud,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
_v.en: and again appealed to them publicly and confided with them privately,

_v.ar: فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
_v.en: telling [them]: ‘‘Plead to your Lord for forgiveness. Indeed, He is all-forgiving.

_v.ar: يُرْسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيْكُم مِّدْرَارًا
_v.en: He will send for you abundant rains from the sky,

_v.ar: وَيُمْدِدْكُم بِأَمْوَٰلٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍ وَيَجْعَل لَّكُمْ أَنْهَـٰرًا
_v.en: and aid you with wealth and sons, and provide you with gardens and provide you with streams.

_v.ar: مَّا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
_v.en: What is the matter with you that you do not look upon Allah with veneration,

_v.ar: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
_v.en: though He has created you in [various] stages?

_v.ar: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ كَيْفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَـٰوَٰتٍ طِبَاقًا
_v.en: Have you not seen how Allah has created the seven heavens in layers,

_v.ar: وَجَعَلَ ٱلْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
_v.en: and has made therein the moon for a light and the sun for a lamp?

_v.ar: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
_v.en: Allah made you grow from the earth, with a [vegetable] growth.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
_v.en: Then He makes you return to it, and He will bring you forth [without fail].

_v.ar: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
_v.en: Allah has made the earth a vast expanse for you

_v.ar: لِّتَسْلُكُوا۟ مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
_v.en: so that you may travel over its spacious ways.’’ ’

_v.ar: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِى وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ مَن لَّمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
_v.en: Noah said, ‘My Lord! They have disobeyed me, following someone whose wealth and children only add to his loss,

_v.ar: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
_v.en: and they have devised an outrageous plot.

_v.ar: وَقَالُوا۟ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
_v.en: They say, ‘‘Do not abandon your gods. Do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghuth, Ya‘uq and Nasr,’’

_v.ar: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا۟ كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَـٰلًا
_v.en: and already they have led many astray. Do not increase the wrongdoers in anything but error.’

_v.ar: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٔـٰتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا۟ فَأُدْخِلُوا۟ نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارًا
_v.en: They were drowned because of their iniquities, then made to enter a Fire, and they did not find any helpers for themselves besides Allah.

_v.ar: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
_v.en: And Noah said, ‘My Lord! ‘Do not leave on the earth any inhabitant from among the faithless.

_v.ar: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا۟ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
_v.en: If You leave them, they will lead astray Your servants, and will beget none except vicious ingrates.

_v.ar: رَّبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَىَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِىَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًۢا
_v.en: My Lord! Forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house in faith, and the faithful men and women, and do not increase the wrongdoers in anything but ruin.’

_v.ar: قُلْ أُوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْءَانًا عَجَبًا
_v.en: Say, ‘It has been revealed to me that a team of the jinn listened [to the Quran] and they said, “Indeed we heard a wonderful Quran,

_v.ar: يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشْدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦ ۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدًا
_v.en: which guides to rectitude. Hence, we have believed in it and we will never ascribe any partner to our Lord.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَـٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَـٰحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
_v.en: Exalted be the majesty of our Lord; He has taken neither any spouse nor son.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطًا
_v.en: The foolish ones among us used to speak atrocious lies concerning Allah.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلْإِنسُ وَٱلْجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا
_v.en: We thought that humans and jinn would never utter any falsehood concerning Allah.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ ٱلْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
_v.en: Indeed some persons from the humans would seek the protection of some persons from the jinn, thus only adding to their rebellion.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا۟ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدًا
_v.en: They thought, just as you think, that Allah will not raise anyone from the dead.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدْنَـٰهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
_v.en: Indeed we made for the heaven and found it full of mighty sentries and flames.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَـٰعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ ٱلْـَٔانَ يَجِدْ لَهُۥ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا
_v.en: We used to sit in its positions to eavesdrop, but anyone listening now finds a flame waiting for him.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِىٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
_v.en: We do not know whether ill is intended for those who are on the earth, or whether their Lord intends good for them.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّـٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدًا
_v.en: Among us some are righteous and some are otherwise: we are various sects.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعْجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَن نُّعْجِزَهُۥ هَرَبًا
_v.en: We know that we cannot frustrate Allah on the earth, nor can we frustrate Him by fleeing.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ ۖ فَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا
_v.en: When we heard the [message of] guidance, we believed in it. Whoever that has faith in his Lord will fear neither privation nor oppression.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلْقَـٰسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا۟ رَشَدًا
_v.en: Among us some are Muslims and some of us are perverse.” ’ Those who submit [to Allah]—it is they who pursue rectitude.

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا ٱلْقَـٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا۟ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
_v.en: As for the perverse, they will be firewood for hell.

_v.ar: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسْتَقَـٰمُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَـٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقًا
_v.en: If they are steadfast on the path [of Allah], We shall provide them with abundant water,

_v.ar: لِّنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَن يُعْرِضْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا
_v.en: so that We may test them therein, and whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will let him into an escalating punishment.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّ ٱلْمَسَـٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا۟ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدًا
_v.en: The places of worship belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone along with Allah.

_v.ar: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا۟ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
_v.en: When the servant of Allah rose to pray to Him, they almost crowded around him.

_v.ar: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
_v.en: Say, ‘I pray only to my Lord, and I do not ascribe any partner to Him.’

_v.ar: قُلْ إِنِّى لَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا
_v.en: Say, ‘I have no power to bring you any harm or good [of my own accord].’

_v.ar: قُلْ إِنِّى لَن يُجِيرَنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًا
_v.en: Say, ‘Neither can anyone shelter me from Allah, nor can I find any refuge besides Him.

_v.ar: إِلَّا بَلَـٰغًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَـٰلَـٰتِهِۦ ۚ وَمَن يَعْصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا
_v.en: [I have no duty] except to transmit from Allah, and [to communicate] His messages; and whoever disobeys Allah and His apostle, there will indeed be for him the fire of hell, to remain in it forever.’

_v.ar: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
_v.en: When they see what they are promised, they will know who is weaker in supporters and fewer in numbers.

_v.ar: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّىٓ أَمَدًا
_v.en: Say, ‘I do not know if what you are promised is near, or if my Lord has set a [long] term for it.’

_v.ar: عَـٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
_v.en: Knower of the Unseen, He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] Unseen to anyone,

_v.ar: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسْلُكُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِۦ رَصَدًا
_v.en: except to an apostle He approves of. Then He dispatches a sentinel before and behind him

_v.ar: لِّيَعْلَمَ أَن قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا۟ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عَدَدًۢا
_v.en: so that He may ascertain that they have communicated the messages of their Lord, and He encompasses all that is with them, and He keeps an count of all things.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُزَّمِّلُ
_v.en: O you wrapped up in your mantle!

_v.ar: قُمِ ٱلَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
_v.en: Stand vigil through the night, except for a little [of it],

_v.ar: نِّصْفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
_v.en: a half, or reduce a little from that

_v.ar: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَرْتِيلًا
_v.en: or add to it, and recite the Quran in a measured tone.

_v.ar: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِى عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا
_v.en: Indeed soon We shall cast on you a weighty discourse.

_v.ar: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ هِىَ أَشَدُّ وَطْـًٔا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
_v.en: Indeed the watch of the night is firmer in tread and more upright in respect to speech,

_v.ar: إِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
_v.en: for indeed during the day you have drawn-out engagements.

_v.ar: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
_v.en: So celebrate the Name of your Lord and dedicate yourself to Him with total dedication.

_v.ar: رَّبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
_v.en: Lord of the east and the west, there is no god except Him; so take Him for your trustee,

_v.ar: وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
_v.en: and be patient over what they say, and distance yourself from them in a graceful manner.

_v.ar: وَذَرْنِى وَٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُو۟لِى ٱلنَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
_v.en: Leave Me [to deal] with the deniers, the opulent, and give them a little respite.

_v.ar: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَآ أَنكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا
_v.en: Indeed with Us are heavy fetters and a fierce fire,

_v.ar: وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
_v.en: and a food that chokes [those who eat it], and a painful punishment [prepared for]

_v.ar: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَّهِيلًا
_v.en: the day when the earth and the mountains will quake, and the mountains will be like dunes of shifting sand.

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَـٰهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا
_v.en: Indeed We have sent to you an apostle, to be a witness to you, just as We sent an apostle to Pharaoh.

_v.ar: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا
_v.en: But Pharaoh disobeyed the apostle; so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

_v.ar: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ ٱلْوِلْدَٰنَ شِيبًا
_v.en: So, if you disbelieve, how will you avoid the day, which will make children white-headed,

_v.ar: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرٌۢ بِهِۦ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَفْعُولًا
_v.en: and wherein the sky will be rent apart? His promise is bound to be fulfilled.

_v.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
_v.en: This is indeed a reminder. So let anyone who wishes take the way toward his Lord.

_v.ar: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَىِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٌ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرْضَىٰ ۙ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ ۙ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَـٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ فَٱقْرَءُوا۟ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا۟ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا ۚ وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌۢ
_v.en: Indeed your Lord knows that you stand vigil for nearly two thirds of the night—or [at times] a half or a third of it—along with a group of those who are with you. Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you cannot calculate it [exactly], and so He was lenient toward you. So recite as much of the Quran as is feasible. He knows that some of you will be sick, while others will travel in the land seeking Allah’s bounty, and yet others will fight in the way of Allah. So recite as much of it as is feasible, and maintain the prayer and pay the zakat and lend Allah a good loan. Whatever good you send ahead for your souls you will find it with Allah [in a form] that is better and greater with respect to reward. And plead to Allah for forgiveness; indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُدَّثِّرُ
_v.en: O you wrapped up in your mantle!

_v.ar: قُمْ فَأَنذِرْ
_v.en: Rise up and warn!

_v.ar: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ
_v.en: Magnify your Lord,

_v.ar: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ
_v.en: and purify your clothes,

_v.ar: وَٱلرُّجْزَ فَٱهْجُرْ
_v.en: and keep away from all impurity!

_v.ar: وَلَا تَمْنُن تَسْتَكْثِرُ
_v.en: Do not grant a favour seeking a greater gain,

_v.ar: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصْبِرْ
_v.en: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِى ٱلنَّاقُورِ
_v.en: When the Trumpet will be sounded,

_v.ar: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ
_v.en: that will be a day of hardship,

_v.ar: عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ
_v.en: not at all easy for the faithless.

_v.ar: ذَرْنِى وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًا
_v.en: Leave Me [to deal] with him whom I created alone,

_v.ar: وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُۥ مَالًا مَّمْدُودًا
_v.en: and furnished him with extensive means,

_v.ar: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًا
_v.en: [gave him] sons to be at his side,

_v.ar: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمْهِيدًا
_v.en: and facilitated [all matters] for him.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ يَطْمَعُ أَنْ أَزِيدَ
_v.en: Still he is eager that I should give him more.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا عَنِيدًا
_v.en: No indeed! He is an obstinate opponent of Our signs.

_v.ar: سَأُرْهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا
_v.en: Soon I will overwhelm him with hardship.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
_v.en: Indeed he reflected and decided.

_v.ar: فَقُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
_v.en: Perish he, how he decided!

_v.ar: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
_v.en: Again, perish he, how he decided!

_v.ar: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ
_v.en: Then he looked;

_v.ar: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ
_v.en: then frowned and scowled.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ وَٱسْتَكْبَرَ
_v.en: Then he walked away disdainfully,

_v.ar: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ
_v.en: saying, ‘It is nothing but traditional sorcery.

_v.ar: إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوْلُ ٱلْبَشَرِ
_v.en: It is nothing but the speech of a human.’

_v.ar: سَأُصْلِيهِ سَقَرَ
_v.en: Soon I will cast him into Saqar.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ
_v.en: And what will show you what is Saqar?

_v.ar: لَا تُبْقِى وَلَا تَذَرُ
_v.en: It neither spares, nor leaves [anything].

_v.ar: لَوَّاحَةٌ لِّلْبَشَرِ
_v.en: It burns the skin.

_v.ar: عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ
_v.en: There are nineteen [keepers] over it.

_v.ar: وَمَا جَعَلْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَـٰٓئِكَةً ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَيَزْدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِيمَـٰنًا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌ وَٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَـٰذَا مَثَلًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِىَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
_v.en: We have assigned only angels as keepers of the Fire, and We have made their number merely a stumbling block for the faithless, and so that those who were given the Book may be reassured, and the faithful may increase in [their] faith, and so that those who were given the Book and the faithful may not be in doubt, and so that the faithless and those in whose hearts is a sickness may say, ‘What did Allah mean by this description?’ Thus does Allah lead astray whomever He wishes and guides whomever He wishes. No one knows the hosts of your Lord except Him, and it is just an admonition for all humans.

_v.ar: كَلَّا وَٱلْقَمَرِ
_v.en: No indeed! By the Moon!

_v.ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ
_v.en: By the night when it recedes!

_v.ar: وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَآ أَسْفَرَ
_v.en: By the dawn when it brightens!

_v.ar: إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى ٱلْكُبَرِ
_v.en: Indeed they are one of the greatest [signs of God]

_v.ar: نَذِيرًا لِّلْبَشَرِ
_v.en: —a warner to all humans,

_v.ar: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
_v.en: [alike] for those of you who like to advance ahead and those who would remain behind.

_v.ar: كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ
_v.en: Every soul is hostage to what it has earned,

_v.ar: إِلَّآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْيَمِينِ
_v.en: except the People of the Right Hand.

_v.ar: فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
_v.en: [They will be] in gardens, questioning

_v.ar: عَنِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
_v.en: the guilty:

_v.ar: مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِى سَقَرَ
_v.en: ‘What drew you into Hell?’

_v.ar: قَالُوا۟ لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلْمُصَلِّينَ
_v.en: They will answer, ‘We were not among those who prayed.

_v.ar: وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ ٱلْمِسْكِينَ
_v.en: Nor did we feed the poor.

_v.ar: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلْخَآئِضِينَ
_v.en: We used to indulge in [profane] gossip along with the gossipers,

_v.ar: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: and we used to deny the Day of Retribution

_v.ar: حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلْيَقِينُ
_v.en: until death came to us.’

_v.ar: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمْ شَفَـٰعَةُ ٱلشَّـٰفِعِينَ
_v.en: So the intercession of the intercessors will not avail them.

_v.ar: فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ ٱلتَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ
_v.en: What is the matter with them that they evade the Reminder

_v.ar: كَأَنَّهُمْ حُمُرٌ مُّسْتَنفِرَةٌ
_v.en: as if they were terrified asses

_v.ar: فَرَّتْ مِن قَسْوَرَةٍۭ
_v.en: fleeing from a lion?

_v.ar: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُّنَشَّرَةً
_v.en: But everyone of them desires to be given unrolled scriptures [from Allah]!

_v.ar: كَلَّا ۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ
_v.en: No! Indeed, they do not fear the Hereafter.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذْكِرَةٌ
_v.en: No! It is indeed a reminder.

_v.ar: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
_v.en: So let anyone who wishes be mindful of it.

_v.ar: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ
_v.en: And they will not be mindful unless Allah wishes. He is worthy of [your] being wary [of Him] and He is worthy to forgive.

_v.ar: لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ
_v.en: I swear by the Day of Resurrection!

_v.ar: وَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلنَّفْسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ
_v.en: And I swear by the self-critical soul!

_v.ar: أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ
_v.en: Does man suppose that We will not put together his bones [at resurrection]?

_v.ar: بَلَىٰ قَـٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ
_v.en: Yes indeed, We are able to [re]shape [even] his fingertips!

_v.ar: بَلْ يُرِيدُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ
_v.en: Indeed, man desires to go on living viciously.

_v.ar: يَسْـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ
_v.en: He asks, ‘When will be this “day of resurrection”?!’

_v.ar: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلْبَصَرُ
_v.en: But when the eyes are dazzled,

_v.ar: وَخَسَفَ ٱلْقَمَرُ
_v.en: the moon is eclipsed,

_v.ar: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ
_v.en: and the sun and the moon are brought together,

_v.ar: يَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ ٱلْمَفَرُّ
_v.en: that day man will say, ‘Where is the escape [from this day]?’

_v.ar: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ
_v.en: No indeed! There will be no refuge!

_v.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمُسْتَقَرُّ
_v.en: That day the [final] goal will be toward your Lord.

_v.ar: يُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
_v.en: That day man will be informed about what [works] he had sent ahead [to the scene of judgement] and [the legacy that he had] left behind.

_v.ar: بَلِ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٌ
_v.en: Indeed, man is a witness to himself,

_v.ar: وَلَوْ أَلْقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ
_v.en: though he should offer excuses [to justify his failings].

_v.ar: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
_v.en: Do not move your tongue with it to hasten it.

_v.ar: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا جَمْعَهُۥ وَقُرْءَانَهُۥ
_v.en: Indeed it is up to Us to put it together and to recite it.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا قَرَأْنَـٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعْ قُرْءَانَهُۥ
_v.en: And when We have recited it, follow its recitation.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا بَيَانَهُۥ
_v.en: Then, its exposition [also] lies with Us.

_v.ar: كَلَّا بَلْ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ
_v.en: No! Indeed, you love this transitory life

_v.ar: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ
_v.en: and forsake the Hereafter.

_v.ar: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاضِرَةٌ
_v.en: Some faces will be fresh on that day,

_v.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٌ
_v.en: looking to their Lord,

_v.ar: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَاسِرَةٌ
_v.en: and some faces will be scowling on that day,

_v.ar: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفْعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٌ
_v.en: knowing that they will be dealt out a punishment breaking the spine.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِىَ
_v.en: No indeed! When it reaches up to the collar bones

_v.ar: وَقِيلَ مَنْ ۜ رَاقٍ
_v.en: and it is said, ‘Who will take him up?’

_v.ar: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلْفِرَاقُ
_v.en: and he knows that it is the [time of] parting,

_v.ar: وَٱلْتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ
_v.en: and each shank clasps the other shank,

_v.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْمَسَاقُ
_v.en: that day he shall be driven toward your Lord.

_v.ar: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ
_v.en: He neither confirmed [the messages of Allah], nor did he pray,

_v.ar: وَلَـٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
_v.en: but denied [them] and turned away,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ
_v.en: and went back swaggering to his family.

_v.ar: أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ
_v.en: So, woe to you! Woe to you!

_v.ar: ثُمَّ أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰٓ
_v.en: Again, woe to you! Woe to you!

_v.ar: أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَن يُتْرَكَ سُدًى
_v.en: Does man suppose that he has been abandoned to futility?

_v.ar: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِّن مَّنِىٍّ يُمْنَىٰ
_v.en: Was he not a drop of emitted semen,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
_v.en: and then a clinging mass? Whereat He created and proportioned [him],

_v.ar: فَجَعَلَ مِنْهُ ٱلزَّوْجَيْنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰٓ
_v.en: and made of him the two sexes, male and female.

_v.ar: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَـٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحْـِۧىَ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ
_v.en: Is not [someone like] that able to revive the dead?

_v.ar: هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَـٰنِ حِينٌ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًٔا مَّذْكُورًا
_v.en: Has there been a period of time for man when he was not anything worthy of mention?

_v.ar: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ سَمِيعًۢا بَصِيرًا
_v.en: Indeed We created man from the drop of a mixed fluid so that We may put him to test, so We endowed with hearing and sight.

_v.ar: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
_v.en: Indeed We have guided him to the way, be he grateful or ungrateful.

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ سَلَـٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغْلَـٰلًا وَسَعِيرًا
_v.en: Indeed for the faithless We have prepared chains, iron collars, and a blaze.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
_v.en: Indeed the pious will drink from a cup seasoned with Kafur,

_v.ar: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
_v.en: a spring where Allah’s servants will drink, making it gush forth as they please.

_v.ar: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسْتَطِيرًا
_v.en: They fulfill their vows and fear a day whose ill will be widespread.

_v.ar: وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
_v.en: For the love of Him, they feed the needy, the orphan and the prisoner,

_v.ar: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَآءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
_v.en: [saying,] ‘We feed you only for the sake of Allah. We desire no reward from you, nor thanks.

_v.ar: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
_v.en: Indeed we fear a frowning and fateful day from our Lord.’

_v.ar: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا
_v.en: So Allah saved them from that day’s ills and graced them with freshness [on this faces] and joy [in their hearts].

_v.ar: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا
_v.en: He rewarded them for their patience with a garden and [garments of] silk,

_v.ar: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا
_v.en: reclining therein on couches, without facing any [scorching] sun, or [biting] cold.

_v.ar: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَـٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا
_v.en: Its shades will be close over them and its clusters [of fruits] will be hanging low.

_v.ar: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٍ مِّن فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا۠
_v.en: They will be served around with vessels of silver and goblets of crystal

_v.ar: قَوَارِيرَا۟ مِن فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا
_v.en: —crystal of silver— [from] which they will dispense in a precise measure.

_v.ar: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
_v.en: They will be served therein with a cup of a drink seasoned with Zanjabeel,

_v.ar: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا
_v.en: from a spring in it named Salsabeel.

_v.ar: وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَّنثُورًا
_v.en: They will be waited upon by immortal youths, whom, were you to see them, you will suppose them to be scattered pearls.

_v.ar: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا
_v.en: As you look on, you will see there bliss and a great kingdom.

_v.ar: عَـٰلِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلُّوٓا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا
_v.en: Upon them will be cloaks of green silk and brocade and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. Their Lord will give them to drink a pure drink.

_v.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَآءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا
_v.en: [They will be told]: ‘This is your reward, and your efforts have been well-appreciated.’

_v.ar: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَنزِيلًا
_v.en: Indeed We have sent down to you the Quran in a gradual descent.

_v.ar: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ ءَاثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا
_v.en: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord and do not obey any sinner or ingrate from among them,

_v.ar: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
_v.en: and celebrate the Name of your Lord morning and evening,

_v.ar: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَٱسْجُدْ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا
_v.en: and worship Him for a watch of the night and glorify Him the night long.

_v.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا
_v.en: Indeed they love this transitory life, and disregard a heavy day that is ahead of them.

_v.ar: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَـٰهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَآ أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَآ أَمْثَـٰلَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
_v.en: We created them and strengthened their joints, and We will replace them with others like them whenever We like.

_v.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
_v.en: This is indeed a reminder. So let anyone who wishes take the way toward his Lord.

_v.ar: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
_v.en: But you will not wish unless it is willed by Allah. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.

_v.ar: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ وَٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۢا
_v.en: He admits whomever He wishes into His mercy, and He has prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers.

_v.ar: وَٱلْمُرْسَلَـٰتِ عُرْفًا
_v.en: By the [angelic] emissaries sent successively,

_v.ar: فَٱلْعَـٰصِفَـٰتِ عَصْفًا
_v.en: by those who sweep along like gale,

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّـٰشِرَٰتِ نَشْرًا
_v.en: by those who publish [the Divine messages] far and wide,

_v.ar: فَٱلْفَـٰرِقَـٰتِ فَرْقًا
_v.en: by those who separate [the truth from falsehood] distinctly,

_v.ar: فَٱلْمُلْقِيَـٰتِ ذِكْرًا
_v.en: by those who inspire [God’s] remembrance,

_v.ar: عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا
_v.en: as exemption or warning:

_v.ar: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٌ
_v.en: what you are promised will surely befall.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ
_v.en: When the stars are blotted out

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتْ
_v.en: and the sky is cleft,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ
_v.en: when the mountains are scattered [like dust]

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتْ
_v.en: and time is set for the apostles [to bear witness]

_v.ar: لِأَىِّ يَوْمٍ أُجِّلَتْ
_v.en: —for what day has [all] that been set [to occur]?

_v.ar: لِيَوْمِ ٱلْفَصْلِ
_v.en: For the Day of Judgement!

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ
_v.en: And what will show you what is the Day of Judgement!?

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: أَلَمْ نُهْلِكِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
_v.en: Did We not destroy the former generations,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ نُتْبِعُهُمُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
_v.en: [and] then made the latter ones follow them?

_v.ar: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
_v.en: That is how We deal with the guilty.

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: أَلَمْ نَخْلُقكُّم مِّن مَّآءٍ مَّهِينٍ
_v.en: Have We not created you from a base fluid,

_v.ar: فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ فِى قَرَارٍ مَّكِينٍ
_v.en: [and] then lodged it in a secure abode

_v.ar: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
_v.en: until a known span [of time]?

_v.ar: فَقَدَرْنَا فَنِعْمَ ٱلْقَـٰدِرُونَ
_v.en: Then We determined; and how excellent determiners We are!

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلْأَرْضَ كِفَاتًا
_v.en: Have We not made the earth a receptacle

_v.ar: أَحْيَآءً وَأَمْوَٰتًا
_v.en: for the living and the dead,

_v.ar: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ شَـٰمِخَـٰتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَـٰكُم مَّآءً فُرَاتًا
_v.en: and set in it lofty [and] firm mountains, and given you agreeable water to drink?

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
_v.en: [The faithless will be told:] ‘Proceed toward what you used to deny!

_v.ar: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِى ثَلَـٰثِ شُعَبٍ
_v.en: Proceed toward the triple-forked shadow,

_v.ar: لَّا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ
_v.en: neither shady nor of any avail against the flames.

_v.ar: إِنَّهَا تَرْمِى بِشَرَرٍ كَٱلْقَصْرِ
_v.en: Indeed it throws up [giant] sparks like castles,

_v.ar: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَـٰلَتٌ صُفْرٌ
_v.en: [bright] like yellow camels.

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
_v.en: This is a day wherein they will not speak,

_v.ar: وَلَا يُؤْذَنُ لَهُمْ فَيَعْتَذِرُونَ
_v.en: nor will they be permitted to offer excuses.

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ۖ جَمَعْنَـٰكُمْ وَٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
_v.en: ‘This is the Day of Judgement. We have brought you together with the former generations.

_v.ar: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ
_v.en: If you have any stratagems [left], try them out against Me!’

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى ظِلَـٰلٍ وَعُيُونٍ
_v.en: Indeed the Godwary will be amid shades and springs

_v.ar: وَفَوَٰكِهَ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
_v.en: and [enjoying] such fruits as they desire.

_v.ar: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
_v.en: [They will be told:] ‘Enjoy your food and drink, [a reward] for what you used to do.

_v.ar: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
_v.en: Thus do We reward the virtuous.’

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: كُلُوا۟ وَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجْرِمُونَ
_v.en: ‘Eat and enjoy a little! You are indeed guilty.’

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرْكَعُوا۟ لَا يَرْكَعُونَ
_v.en: When they are told, ‘Bow down [in prayer],’ they do not bow down!

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day!

_v.ar: فَبِأَىِّ حَدِيثٍۭ بَعْدَهُۥ يُؤْمِنُونَ
_v.en: So what discourse will they believe after this?

_v.ar: عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
_v.en: What is it that they are questioning each other about?!

_v.ar: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
_v.en: [Is it] about the Great Tiding,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ
_v.en: the one about which they differ?

_v.ar: كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: No indeed! Soon they will know!

_v.ar: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: No indeed! Soon they will know for once again!

_v.ar: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِهَـٰدًا
_v.en: Did We not make the earth a resting place?

_v.ar: وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا
_v.en: and the mountains stakes?

_v.ar: وَخَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا
_v.en: and create you in pairs?

_v.ar: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا
_v.en: and make your sleep for rest?

_v.ar: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا
_v.en: and make the night a covering?

_v.ar: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشًا
_v.en: and make the day for livelihood?

_v.ar: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا
_v.en: and build above you the seven mighty heavens?

_v.ar: وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجًا وَهَّاجًا
_v.en: and make [the sun for] a radiant lamp?

_v.ar: وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمُعْصِرَٰتِ مَآءً ثَجَّاجًا
_v.en: and send down water pouring from the rain-clouds,

_v.ar: لِّنُخْرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبًّا وَنَبَاتًا
_v.en: that We may bring forth with it grains and plants,

_v.ar: وَجَنَّـٰتٍ أَلْفَافًا
_v.en: and luxuriant gardens?

_v.ar: إِنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَـٰتًا
_v.en: Indeed the Day of Judgement is the tryst,

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا
_v.en: the day the Trumpet will be blown, and you will come in groups,

_v.ar: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَٰبًا
_v.en: and the sky will be opened and become gates,

_v.ar: وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا
_v.en: and the mountains will be set moving and become a mirage.

_v.ar: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا
_v.en: Indeed hell is in ambush,

_v.ar: لِّلطَّـٰغِينَ مَـَٔابًا
_v.en: a resort for the rebels,

_v.ar: لَّـٰبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحْقَابًا
_v.en: to reside therein for ages,

_v.ar: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا
_v.en: tasting in it neither any coolness nor drink,

_v.ar: إِلَّا حَمِيمًا وَغَسَّاقًا
_v.en: except boiling water and pus,

_v.ar: جَزَآءً وِفَاقًا
_v.en: a fitting requital.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا
_v.en: Indeed they did not expect any reckoning,

_v.ar: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا كِذَّابًا
_v.en: and they denied Our signs mendaciously,

_v.ar: وَكُلَّ شَىْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَـٰهُ كِتَـٰبًا
_v.en: and We have figured everything in a Book.

_v.ar: فَذُوقُوا۟ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمْ إِلَّا عَذَابًا
_v.en: So [now] taste! We shall increase you in nothing but punishment!

_v.ar: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
_v.en: Indeed a triumph awaits the Godwary:

_v.ar: حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعْنَـٰبًا
_v.en: gardens and vineyards,

_v.ar: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَابًا
_v.en: and buxom maidens of a like age,

_v.ar: وَكَأْسًا دِهَاقًا
_v.en: and brimming cups.

_v.ar: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّٰبًا
_v.en: Therein they shall hear neither vain talk nor lies

_v.ar: جَزَآءً مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَابًا
_v.en: —a reward and a sufficing bounty from your Lord,

_v.ar: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا
_v.en: the All-beneficent, the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. They will not be able to address Him

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ صَفًّا ۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا
_v.en: on the day when the Spirit and the angels stand in an array: none shall speak except someone who is permitted by the All-beneficent and says what is rightful.

_v.ar: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
_v.en: That day is true for certain. So let anyone who wishes take resort with his Lord.

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَنذَرْنَـٰكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلْكَافِرُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى كُنتُ تُرَٰبًۢا
_v.en: Indeed We have warned you of a punishment near at hand—the day when a person will observe what his hands have sent ahead and the faithless one will say, ‘I wish I were dust!’

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّـٰزِعَـٰتِ غَرْقًا
_v.en: By those [angels] who wrest [the soul] violently,

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّـٰشِطَـٰتِ نَشْطًا
_v.en: by those who draw [it] out gently,

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّـٰبِحَـٰتِ سَبْحًا
_v.en: by those who swim smoothly,

_v.ar: فَٱلسَّـٰبِقَـٰتِ سَبْقًا
_v.en: by those who, racing, take the lead,

_v.ar: فَٱلْمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمْرًا
_v.en: by those who direct the affairs [of creatures]:

_v.ar: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ
_v.en: the day when the Quaker quakes

_v.ar: تَتْبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ
_v.en: and is followed by the Successor,

_v.ar: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ
_v.en: hearts will be trembling on that day,

_v.ar: أَبْصَـٰرُهَا خَـٰشِعَةٌ
_v.en: bearing a humbled look.

_v.ar: يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِى ٱلْحَافِرَةِ
_v.en: They will say, ‘Are we being returned to our earlier state?

_v.ar: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَـٰمًا نَّخِرَةً
_v.en: What, even after we have been decayed bones?!’

_v.ar: قَالُوا۟ تِلْكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ
_v.en: They will say, ‘This is, then, a ruinous return!’

_v.ar: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ
_v.en: Yet it will be only a single shout,

_v.ar: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ
_v.en: and behold, they will be awake.

_v.ar: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ
_v.en: Did you receive the story of Moses,

_v.ar: إِذْ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
_v.en: when his Lord called out to him in the holy valley of Tuwa?

_v.ar: ٱذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ
_v.en: [And said,] ‘Go to Pharaoh, for indeed he has rebelled,

_v.ar: فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ
_v.en: and say, ‘‘Would you purify yourself?

_v.ar: وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ
_v.en: I will guide you to your Lord, that you may fear [Him]?’’ ’

_v.ar: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلْـَٔايَةَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
_v.en: Then he showed him the greatest sign.

_v.ar: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ
_v.en: But he denied, and disobeyed.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ
_v.en: Then he turned back, walking swiftly,

_v.ar: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ
_v.en: and gathered [the people] and proclaimed,

_v.ar: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
_v.en: saying, ‘I am your exalted lord!’

_v.ar: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَٱلْأُولَىٰٓ
_v.en: So Allah seized him with the punishment of this life and the Hereafter.

_v.ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰٓ
_v.en: There is indeed a moral in that for someone who fears!

_v.ar: ءَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ ۚ بَنَىٰهَا
_v.en: Is your creation more prodigious or that of the heaven He has built?

_v.ar: رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا
_v.en: He raised its vault and fashioned it,

_v.ar: وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا
_v.en: and darkened its night, and brought forth its forenoon.

_v.ar: وَٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَىٰهَآ
_v.en: Thereafter He spread out the earth,

_v.ar: أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرْعَىٰهَا
_v.en: brought forth from it its water and pastures,

_v.ar: وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَرْسَىٰهَا
_v.en: setting firm the mountains,

_v.ar: مَتَـٰعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَـٰمِكُمْ
_v.en: as a [place of] sustenance for you and your livestock.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
_v.en: When the Greatest Catastrophe befalls

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ
_v.en: —the day when man will remember his endeavours

_v.ar: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ
_v.en: and hell is brought into view for those who can see—

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ
_v.en: as for him who has been rebellious

_v.ar: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
_v.en: and preferred the life of this world,

_v.ar: فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ هِىَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ
_v.en: his refuge will indeed be hell.

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفْسَ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ
_v.en: But as for him who is awed to stand before his Lord and restrains his soul from [following] desires,

_v.ar: فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَنَّةَ هِىَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ
_v.en: his refuge will indeed be paradise.

_v.ar: يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَىٰهَا
_v.en: They ask you concerning the Hour, “When will it set in,

_v.ar: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكْرَىٰهَآ
_v.en: considering your frequent mention of it?”

_v.ar: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَآ
_v.en: Its outcome is with your Lord.

_v.ar: إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰهَا
_v.en: You are only a warner for those who are afraid it.

_v.ar: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَىٰهَا
_v.en: The day they see it, it shall be as if they had not stayed [in the world] except for an evening or forenoon.

_v.ar: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
_v.en: He frowned and turned away

_v.ar: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ
_v.en: when the blind man approached him.

_v.ar: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ
_v.en: And how do you know, maybe he would purify himself,

_v.ar: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰٓ
_v.en: or take admonition, and the admonition would benefit him!

_v.ar: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَغْنَىٰ
_v.en: But as for someone who is wealthy,

_v.ar: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ
_v.en: you attend to him,

_v.ar: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
_v.en: though you are not liable if he does not purify himself.

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ
_v.en: But as for someone who comes hurrying to you,

_v.ar: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ
_v.en: while he fears [Allah],

_v.ar: فَأَنتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ
_v.en: you are neglectful of him.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ
_v.en: No indeed! These [verses of the Quran ] are a reminder

_v.ar: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
_v.en: —so let anyone who wishes remember—

_v.ar: فِى صُحُفٍ مُّكَرَّمَةٍ
_v.en: in honoured scriptures,

_v.ar: مَّرْفُوعَةٍ مُّطَهَّرَةٍۭ
_v.en: exalted and purified,

_v.ar: بِأَيْدِى سَفَرَةٍ
_v.en: in the hands of envoys,

_v.ar: كِرَامٍۭ بَرَرَةٍ
_v.en: noble and pious.

_v.ar: قُتِلَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مَآ أَكْفَرَهُۥ
_v.en: Perish man! How ungrateful is he!

_v.ar: مِنْ أَىِّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ
_v.en: From what did He create him?

_v.ar: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ
_v.en: He created him from a drop of [seminal] fluid; then proportioned him.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُۥ
_v.en: Then He made the way easy for him;

_v.ar: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقْبَرَهُۥ
_v.en: then He made him die and buried him;

_v.ar: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ
_v.en: and then, when He wished, resurrected him.

_v.ar: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُۥ
_v.en: No indeed! He has not yet carried out what He has commanded him.

_v.ar: فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦٓ
_v.en: Let man consider his food:

_v.ar: أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا ٱلْمَآءَ صَبًّا
_v.en: We pour down plenteous water [from the sky],

_v.ar: ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ شَقًّا
_v.en: then We split the earth making fissures in it

_v.ar: فَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبًّا
_v.en: and make the grain grow in it,

_v.ar: وَعِنَبًا وَقَضْبًا
_v.en: as well as vines and vegetables,

_v.ar: وَزَيْتُونًا وَنَخْلًا
_v.en: olives and date palms,

_v.ar: وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلْبًا
_v.en: and densely-planted gardens,

_v.ar: وَفَـٰكِهَةً وَأَبًّا
_v.en: fruits and pastures,

_v.ar: مَّتَـٰعًا لَّكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَـٰمِكُمْ
_v.en: as a sustenance for you and your livestock.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ
_v.en: So when the deafening Cry comes—

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ
_v.en: the day when a man will evade his brother,

_v.ar: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِيهِ
_v.en: his mother and his father,

_v.ar: وَصَـٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِيهِ
_v.en: his spouse and his sons—

_v.ar: لِكُلِّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ
_v.en: each of them will have a task to keep him preoccupied on that day.

_v.ar: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُّسْفِرَةٌ
_v.en: Some faces will be bright on that day,

_v.ar: ضَاحِكَةٌ مُّسْتَبْشِرَةٌ
_v.en: laughing and joyous,

_v.ar: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ
_v.en: and some faces on that day will be covered with dust,

_v.ar: تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ
_v.en: overcast with gloom.

_v.ar: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْكَفَرَةُ ٱلْفَجَرَةُ
_v.en: It is they who are the faithless, the vicious.

_v.ar: إِذَا ٱلشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ
_v.en: When the sun is wound up,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتْ
_v.en: when the stars scatter,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ
_v.en: when the mountains are set moving,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ
_v.en: when the pregnant camels are neglected,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ
_v.en: when the wild beasts are mustered,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ
_v.en: when the seas are set afire,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ
_v.en: when the souls are assorted,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْمَوْءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتْ
_v.en: when the girl buried-alive will be asked

_v.ar: بِأَىِّ ذَنۢبٍ قُتِلَتْ
_v.en: for what sin she was killed.

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ
_v.en: When the records [of deeds] are unfolded,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتْ
_v.en: when the sky is stripped off,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ
_v.en: when hell is set ablaze,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ
_v.en: when paradise is brought near,

_v.ar: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّآ أَحْضَرَتْ
_v.en: then a soul shall know what it has readied [for itself].

_v.ar: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلْخُنَّسِ
_v.en: So I swear by the stars that return,

_v.ar: ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْكُنَّسِ
_v.en: the comets,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ
_v.en: by the night as it approaches,

_v.ar: وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ
_v.en: by the dawn as it breathes:

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
_v.en: it is indeed the speech of a noble apostle,

_v.ar: ذِى قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِى ٱلْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ
_v.en: powerful and eminent with the Lord of the Throne,

_v.ar: مُّطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ
_v.en: one who is obeyed and is trustworthy as well.

_v.ar: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجْنُونٍ
_v.en: Your companion is not crazy:

_v.ar: وَلَقَدْ رَءَاهُ بِٱلْأُفُقِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
_v.en: certainly he saw him on the manifest horizon,

_v.ar: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ
_v.en: and he is not miserly concerning the Unseen.

_v.ar: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَـٰنٍ رَّجِيمٍ
_v.en: And it is not the speech of an outcast Satan.

_v.ar: فَأَيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ
_v.en: So where are you going?

_v.ar: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
_v.en: It is just a reminder for all the nations,

_v.ar: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَسْتَقِيمَ
_v.en: for those of you who wish to walk straight;

_v.ar: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
_v.en: but you will not wish unless it is wished by Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.

_v.ar: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتْ
_v.en: When the sky is rent apart,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتْ
_v.en: when the stars are scattered,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ
_v.en: when the seas are merged,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ
_v.en: when the graves are overturned,

_v.ar: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ
_v.en: then a soul shall know what it has sent ahead and left behind.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
_v.en: O man! What has deceived you about your generous Lord,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
_v.en: who created you and proportioned you, and gave you an upright nature,

_v.ar: فِىٓ أَىِّ صُورَةٍ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ
_v.en: and composed you in any form that He wished?

_v.ar: كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: No! Indeed, you deny the Retribution.

_v.ar: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَـٰفِظِينَ
_v.en: Indeed, there are over you watchers,

_v.ar: كِرَامًا كَـٰتِبِينَ
_v.en: noble writers,

_v.ar: يَعْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
_v.en: who know whatever you do.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ لَفِى نَعِيمٍ
_v.en: Indeed the pious shall be amid bliss,

_v.ar: وَإِنَّ ٱلْفُجَّارَ لَفِى جَحِيمٍ
_v.en: and indeed the vicious shall be in hell,

_v.ar: يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: entering it on the Day of Retribution,

_v.ar: وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ
_v.en: and they shall not be absent from it.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: And what will show you what is the Day of Retribution?

_v.ar: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: Again, what will show you what is the Day of Retribution?

_v.ar: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِّنَفْسٍ شَيْـًٔا ۖ وَٱلْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلَّهِ
_v.en: It is a day when no soul will be of any avail to another soul and all command that day will belong to Allah.

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ لِّلْمُطَفِّفِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the defrauders, who use short measures,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
_v.en: who, when they measure [a commodity bought] from the people, take the full measure,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ
_v.en: but diminish when they measure or weigh for them.

_v.ar: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبْعُوثُونَ
_v.en: Do they not know that they will be resurrected

_v.ar: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
_v.en: on a tremendous day,

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
_v.en: a day when mankind will stand before the Lord of all the worlds?

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
_v.en: Indeed, the record of the vicious is in Sijjeen.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ
_v.en: And what will show you what is Sijjeen?

_v.ar: كِتَـٰبٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
_v.en: It is a written record.

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
_v.en: Woe to the deniers on that day,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: who deny the Day of Retribution;

_v.ar: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
_v.en: and none denies it except every sinful transgressor.

_v.ar: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
_v.en: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’

_v.ar: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
_v.en: No, that is not the case! Rather, their hearts have been sullied by what they have been earning.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
_v.en: Indeed, they will be alienated from their Lord on that day.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُوا۟ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
_v.en: Afterward they will enter hell,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
_v.en: then told, ‘This is what you used to deny!’

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
_v.en: Indeed, the record of the pious is in Illeeyun.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ
_v.en: And what will show you what is Illeeyun?

_v.ar: كِتَـٰبٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
_v.en: It is a written record,

_v.ar: يَشْهَدُهُ ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
_v.en: witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ لَفِى نَعِيمٍ
_v.en: The pious shall be amid bliss,

_v.ar: عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
_v.en: observing, [as they recline] on couches.

_v.ar: تَعْرِفُ فِى وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
_v.en: You will perceive in their faces the freshness of bliss.

_v.ar: يُسْقَوْنَ مِن رَّحِيقٍ مَّخْتُومٍ
_v.en: They will be served with a sealed pure wine,

_v.ar: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ
_v.en: whose seal is musk—for such let the viers vie—

_v.ar: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسْنِيمٍ
_v.en: and whose seasoning is from Tasneem,

_v.ar: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
_v.en: a spring where those brought near [to Allah] drink.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
_v.en: Indeed the guilty used to laugh at the faithful,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ
_v.en: and when they passed them by they would wink at each other,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
_v.en: and when they returned to their folks they would return amused,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
_v.en: and when they saw them they would say, ‘Indeed those are the astray!’

_v.ar: وَمَآ أُرْسِلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ حَـٰفِظِينَ
_v.en: Though they were not sent to watch over them.

_v.ar: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
_v.en: So today the faithful will laugh at the faithless,

_v.ar: عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
_v.en: observing from their couches:

_v.ar: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
_v.en: Have the faithless been requited for what they used to do?

_v.ar: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتْ
_v.en: When the sky is split open

_v.ar: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
_v.en: and gives ear to its Lord as it should.

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱلْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ
_v.en: When the earth is spread out

_v.ar: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ
_v.en: and throws out what is in it, emptying itself,

_v.ar: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
_v.en: and gives ear to its Lord as it should.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَـٰقِيهِ
_v.en: O man! You are labouring toward your Lord laboriously, and you will encounter Him.

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ
_v.en: Then, as for him who is given his record [of deeds] in his right hand,

_v.ar: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا
_v.en: he will receive an easy reckoning,

_v.ar: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ مَسْرُورًا
_v.en: and he will return to his folks joyfully.

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهْرِهِۦ
_v.en: But as for him who is given his record from behind his back,

_v.ar: فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُوا۟ ثُبُورًا
_v.en: he will pray for annihilation

_v.ar: وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيرًا
_v.en: and enter the Blaze.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِىٓ أَهْلِهِۦ مَسْرُورًا
_v.en: Indeed he used to be joyful among his folk,

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ
_v.en: and he thought that he would never return.

_v.ar: بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرًا
_v.en: Yes, his Lord had been watching him.

_v.ar: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ
_v.en: I swear by the evening glow,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ
_v.en: by the night and what it is fraught with,

_v.ar: وَٱلْقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ
_v.en: by the moon when it blooms full:

_v.ar: لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٍ
_v.en: you will surely fare from stage to stage.

_v.ar: فَمَا لَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
_v.en: What is the matter with them that they will not believe,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩
_v.en: and will not prostrate when the Quran is recited to them?

_v.ar: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يُكَذِّبُونَ
_v.en: Indeed, the faithless impugn [the Apostle],

_v.ar: وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ
_v.en: and Allah knows best what they keep to themselves.

_v.ar: فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
_v.en: So inform them of a painful punishment,

_v.ar: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍۭ
_v.en: excepting such as are faithful and do righteous deeds: for them there will be an everlasting reward.

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْبُرُوجِ
_v.en: By the heaven with its Houses,

_v.ar: وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْمَوْعُودِ
_v.en: by the Promised Day,

_v.ar: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ
_v.en: by the Witness and the Witnessed:
