_v.ar: قُتِلَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأُخْدُودِ
_v.en: perish the People of the Ditch!

_v.ar: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلْوَقُودِ
_v.en: The fire abounding in fuel,

_v.ar: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ
_v.en: above which they sat

_v.ar: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
_v.en: as they were themselves witnesses to what they did to the faithful.

_v.ar: وَمَا نَقَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
_v.en: They were vindictive towards them only because they had faith in Allah, the All-mighty and the All-laudable,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
_v.en: to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is witness to all things.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا۟ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا۟ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
_v.en: Indeed those who persecute the faithful, men and women, and do not repent thereafter, there is the punishment of hell for them and the punishment of burning.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتٌ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
_v.en: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds—for them will be gardens with streams running in them. That is the supreme success.

_v.ar: إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ
_v.en: Indeed your Lord’s striking is severe.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ يُبْدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ
_v.en: It is indeed He who originates and brings back,

_v.ar: وَهُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلْوَدُودُ
_v.en: and He is the All-forgiving, the All-affectionate,

_v.ar: ذُو ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْمَجِيدُ
_v.en: Lord of the Throne, the All-glorious,

_v.ar: فَعَّالٌ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ
_v.en: doer of what He desires.

_v.ar: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلْجُنُودِ
_v.en: Did you receive the story of the hosts

_v.ar: فِرْعَوْنَ وَثَمُودَ
_v.en: of Pharaoh and Thamud?

_v.ar: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى تَكْذِيبٍ
_v.en: Indeed the faithless dwell in denial,

_v.ar: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَآئِهِم مُّحِيطٌۢ
_v.en: and Allah besieges them from all around.

_v.ar: بَلْ هُوَ قُرْءَانٌ مَّجِيدٌ
_v.en: Indeed it is a glorious Quran,

_v.ar: فِى لَوْحٍ مَّحْفُوظٍۭ
_v.en: in a preserved tablet.

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ
_v.en: By the heaven, and by the nightly visitor

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ
_v.en: (and what will show you what is the nightly visitor?

_v.ar: ٱلنَّجْمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ
_v.en: It is the brilliant star):

_v.ar: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
_v.en: there is a guard over every soul.

_v.ar: فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
_v.en: So let man consider from what he was created.

_v.ar: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٍ دَافِقٍ
_v.en: He was created from an effusing fluid

_v.ar: يَخْرُجُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ ٱلصُّلْبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ
_v.en: which issues from between the loins and the breast-bones.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِۦ لَقَادِرٌ
_v.en: Indeed He is able to bring him back [after death],

_v.ar: يَوْمَ تُبْلَى ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ
_v.en: on the day when the secrets are examined

_v.ar: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
_v.en: and he shall have neither power nor helper.

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجْعِ
_v.en: By the resurgent heaven,

_v.ar: وَٱلْأَرْضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدْعِ
_v.en: and by the furrowed earth:

_v.ar: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلٌ فَصْلٌ
_v.en: it is indeed a conclusive discourse,

_v.ar: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلْهَزْلِ
_v.en: and not a jest.

_v.ar: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا
_v.en: Indeed they are devising a stratagem,

_v.ar: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا
_v.en: and I [too] am devising a plan.

_v.ar: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ أَمْهِلْهُمْ رُوَيْدًۢا
_v.en: So respite the faithless; give them a gentle respite.

_v.ar: سَبِّحِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلْأَعْلَى
_v.en: Celebrate the Name of your Lord, the Most Exalted,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
_v.en: who created and proportioned,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِى قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ
_v.en: who determined and guided,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَخْرَجَ ٱلْمَرْعَىٰ
_v.en: who brought forth the pasture

_v.ar: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَآءً أَحْوَىٰ
_v.en: and then turned it into a black scum.

_v.ar: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰٓ
_v.en: We shall have you recite [the Quran], then you will not forget [any of it]

_v.ar: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
_v.en: except what Allah may wish. Indeed, He knows the open and what is hidden.

_v.ar: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
_v.en: And We shall ease you into facility.

_v.ar: فَذَكِّرْ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
_v.en: So admonish, for admonition is indeed beneficial:

_v.ar: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰ
_v.en: he who fears [God] will take admonition,

_v.ar: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلْأَشْقَى
_v.en: and the most wretched will shun it

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى يَصْلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
_v.en: —he who will enter the Great Fire,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
_v.en: then he will neither live in it, nor die.

_v.ar: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ
_v.en: ‘Felicitous is he who purifies himself,

_v.ar: وَذَكَرَ ٱسْمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ
_v.en: celebrates the Name of his Lord, and prays.

_v.ar: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
_v.en: But you prefer the life of this world,

_v.ar: وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰٓ
_v.en: while the Hereafter is better and more lasting.’

_v.ar: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَفِى ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
_v.en: This is indeed in the former scriptures,

_v.ar: صُحُفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ
_v.en: the scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

_v.ar: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلْغَـٰشِيَةِ
_v.en: Did you receive the account of the Enveloper?

_v.ar: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَـٰشِعَةٌ
_v.en: Some faces on that day will be humbled,

_v.ar: عَامِلَةٌ نَّاصِبَةٌ
_v.en: wrought-up and weary:

_v.ar: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً
_v.en: they will enter a scorching fire

_v.ar: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ ءَانِيَةٍ
_v.en: and made to drink from a boiling spring.

_v.ar: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ
_v.en: They will have no food except cactus,

_v.ar: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِن جُوعٍ
_v.en: neither nourishing, nor of avail against hunger.

_v.ar: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاعِمَةٌ
_v.en: Some faces on that day will be joyous,

_v.ar: لِّسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ
_v.en: pleased with their endeavour,

_v.ar: فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
_v.en: in a lofty garden,

_v.ar: لَّا تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لَـٰغِيَةً
_v.en: where they will not hear any vain talk.

_v.ar: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ
_v.en: In it is a flowing spring

_v.ar: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَّرْفُوعَةٌ
_v.en: and raised couches,

_v.ar: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَّوْضُوعَةٌ
_v.en: with goblets set,

_v.ar: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ
_v.en: and cushions laid out in an array,

_v.ar: وَزَرَابِىُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ
_v.en: and carpets spread out.

_v.ar: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
_v.en: Do they not observe the camel, [to see] how it has been created?

_v.ar: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ
_v.en: and the sky, how it has been raised?

_v.ar: وَإِلَى ٱلْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ
_v.en: and the mountains, how they have been set?

_v.ar: وَإِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ
_v.en: and the earth, how it has been surfaced?

_v.ar: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٌ
_v.en: So admonish—for you are only an admonisher,

_v.ar: لَّسْتَ عَلَيْهِم بِمُصَيْطِرٍ
_v.en: and not a taskmaster over them—

_v.ar: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
_v.en: except him who turns back and disbelieves.

_v.ar: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَكْبَرَ
_v.en: Him Allah will punish with the greatest punishment.

_v.ar: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَآ إِيَابَهُمْ
_v.en: Indeed to Us will be their return.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُم
_v.en: Then, indeed, their reckoning will lie with Us.

_v.ar: وَٱلْفَجْرِ
_v.en: By the Dawn,

_v.ar: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ
_v.en: by the ten nights,

_v.ar: وَٱلشَّفْعِ وَٱلْوَتْرِ
_v.en: by the Even and the Odd,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ
_v.en: by the night when it departs!

_v.ar: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
_v.en: Is there an oath in that for one possessing intellect?

_v.ar: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
_v.en: Have you not regarded how your Lord dealt with [the people of] ‘Ad,

_v.ar: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلْعِمَادِ
_v.en: [and] Iram, [the city] of the pillars,

_v.ar: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
_v.en: the like of which was not created among cities,

_v.ar: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُوا۟ ٱلصَّخْرَ بِٱلْوَادِ
_v.en: and [the people of] Thamud, who hollowed out the rocks in the valley,

_v.ar: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِى ٱلْأَوْتَادِ
_v.en: and Pharaoh, the impaler

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
_v.en: —those who rebelled [against Allah] in their cities

_v.ar: فَأَكْثَرُوا۟ فِيهَا ٱلْفَسَادَ
_v.en: and caused much corruption in them,

_v.ar: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ
_v.en: so your Lord poured on them lashes of punishment.

_v.ar: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلْمِرْصَادِ
_v.en: Indeed your Lord is in ambush.

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
_v.en: As for man, whenever his Lord tests him, and grants him honour, and blesses him, he says, ‘My Lord has honoured me.’

_v.ar: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَـٰنَنِ
_v.en: But when He tests him and tightens for him his provision, he says, ‘My Lord has humiliated me.’

_v.ar: كَلَّا ۖ بَل لَّا تُكْرِمُونَ ٱلْيَتِيمَ
_v.en: No indeed! No, you do not honour the orphan,

_v.ar: وَلَا تَحَـٰٓضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
_v.en: and do not urge the feeding of the needy.

_v.ar: وَتَأْكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكْلًا لَّمًّا
_v.en: You eat the inheritance rapaciously,

_v.ar: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلْمَالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا
_v.en: and love wealth with much fondness.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
_v.en: No indeed! When the earth is levelled to a plain,

_v.ar: وَجَآءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلْمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا
_v.en: and your Lord [’s edict] arrives with the angels in ranks,

_v.ar: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
_v.en: the day when hell is brought [near], man will take admonition on that day, but what will that admonition avail him?

_v.ar: يَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِى
_v.en: He will say, ‘Alas, had I sent ahead for my life [in the Hereafter]!’

_v.ar: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
_v.en: On that day none shall punish as He punishes,

_v.ar: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
_v.en: and none shall bind as He binds.

_v.ar: يَـٰٓأَيَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفْسُ ٱلْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ
_v.en: ‘O soul at peace!

_v.ar: ٱرْجِعِىٓ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَّرْضِيَّةً
_v.en: Return to your Lord, pleased and pleasing!

_v.ar: فَٱدْخُلِى فِى عِبَـٰدِى
_v.en: Then enter among My servants,

_v.ar: وَٱدْخُلِى جَنَّتِى
_v.en: and enter My paradise!’

_v.ar: لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
_v.en: I swear by this town,

_v.ar: وَأَنتَ حِلٌّۢ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
_v.en: as you reside in this town;

_v.ar: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ
_v.en: [and] by the father and him whom he begot:

_v.ar: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ فِى كَبَدٍ
_v.en: certainly We created man in travail.

_v.ar: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
_v.en: Does he suppose that no one will ever have power over him?

_v.ar: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُّبَدًا
_v.en: He says, ‘I have squandered immense wealth.’

_v.ar: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّمْ يَرَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
_v.en: Does he suppose that no one sees him?

_v.ar: أَلَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عَيْنَيْنِ
_v.en: Have We not made for him two eyes,

_v.ar: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ
_v.en: a tongue, and two lips,

_v.ar: وَهَدَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلنَّجْدَيْنِ
_v.en: and shown him the two paths [of good and evil]?

_v.ar: فَلَا ٱقْتَحَمَ ٱلْعَقَبَةَ
_v.en: Yet he has not embarked upon the uphill task.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْعَقَبَةُ
_v.en: And what will show you what is the uphill task?

_v.ar: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
_v.en: [It is] the freeing of a slave,

_v.ar: أَوْ إِطْعَـٰمٌ فِى يَوْمٍ ذِى مَسْغَبَةٍ
_v.en: or feeding, during days of [general] starvation,

_v.ar: يَتِيمًا ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ
_v.en: an orphan among relatives

_v.ar: أَوْ مِسْكِينًا ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ
_v.en: or a needy man in desolation,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
_v.en: while being one of those who have faith and enjoin one another to patience, and enjoin one another to compassion.

_v.ar: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْمَيْمَنَةِ
_v.en: They are the People of the Right Hand.

_v.ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
_v.en: But those who defy Our signs, they are the People of the Left Hand.

_v.ar: عَلَيْهِمْ نَارٌ مُّؤْصَدَةٌۢ
_v.en: A closed Fire will be [imposed] upon them.

_v.ar: وَٱلشَّمْسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا
_v.en: By the sun and her forenoon splendour,

_v.ar: وَٱلْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا
_v.en: by the moon when he follows her,

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا
_v.en: by the day when it reveals her,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰهَا
_v.en: by the night when it covers her,

_v.ar: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا
_v.en: by the sky and Him who built it,

_v.ar: وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا
_v.en: by the earth and Him who spread it,

_v.ar: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا
_v.en: by the soul and Him who fashioned it,

_v.ar: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَىٰهَا
_v.en: and inspired it with [discernment between] its virtues and vices:

_v.ar: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا
_v.en: one who purifies it is felicitous,

_v.ar: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا
_v.en: and one who betrays it fails.

_v.ar: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِطَغْوَىٰهَآ
_v.en: The [people of] Thamud denied [Allah’s signs] out of their rebellion,

_v.ar: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشْقَىٰهَا
_v.en: when the most wretched of them rose up.

_v.ar: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقْيَـٰهَا
_v.en: The apostle of Allah had told them, ‘This is Allah’s she-camel, let her drink!’

_v.ar: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمْ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
_v.en: But they impugned him and hamstrung her. So their Lord took them unawares by night because of their sin, and levelled it.

_v.ar: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقْبَـٰهَا
_v.en: And He does not fear its outcome.

_v.ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ
_v.en: By the night when it envelops,

_v.ar: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ
_v.en: by the day when it brightens,

_v.ar: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰٓ
_v.en: by Him who created the male and the female:

_v.ar: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ
_v.en: your endeavours are indeed diverse.

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ
_v.en: As for him who gives and is Godwary

_v.ar: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلْحُسْنَىٰ
_v.en: and confirms the best promise,

_v.ar: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
_v.en: We will surely ease him toward facility.

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسْتَغْنَىٰ
_v.en: But as for him, who is stingy and self-complacent,

_v.ar: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلْحُسْنَىٰ
_v.en: and denies the best promise,

_v.ar: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ
_v.en: We will surely ease him toward hardship.

_v.ar: وَمَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ
_v.en: His wealth will not avail him when he perishes.

_v.ar: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا لَلْهُدَىٰ
_v.en: Indeed guidance rests with Us,

_v.ar: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلْـَٔاخِرَةَ وَٱلْأُولَىٰ
_v.en: and to Us belong the world and the Hereafter.

_v.ar: فَأَنذَرْتُكُمْ نَارًا تَلَظَّىٰ
_v.en: So I warn you of a blazing fire,

_v.ar: لَا يَصْلَىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلْأَشْقَى
_v.en: which none shall enter except the most wretched [of persons]

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
_v.en: —he who impugns [God’s prophets] and turns his back.

_v.ar: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلْأَتْقَى
_v.en: The Godwary [person] will be spared of that

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى يُؤْتِى مَالَهُۥ يَتَزَكَّىٰ
_v.en: —he who gives his wealth to purify himself

_v.ar: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰٓ
_v.en: and does not expect any reward from anyone,

_v.ar: إِلَّا ٱبْتِغَآءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ
_v.en: but seek only the pleasure of their Lord, the Most Exalted,

_v.ar: وَلَسَوْفَ يَرْضَىٰ
_v.en: and, surely, soon they will be well-pleased.

_v.ar: وَٱلضُّحَىٰ
_v.en: By the morning brightness,

_v.ar: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
_v.en: and by the night when it is calm!

_v.ar: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ
_v.en: Your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased with you,

_v.ar: وَلَلْـَٔاخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
_v.en: and the Hereafter shall be better for you than the world.

_v.ar: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰٓ
_v.en: Soon your Lord will give you [that with which] you will be pleased.

_v.ar: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَـَٔاوَىٰ
_v.en: Did He not find you an orphan, and shelter you?

_v.ar: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلًّا فَهَدَىٰ
_v.en: Did He not find you astray, and guide you?

_v.ar: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ
_v.en: Did He not find you needy, and enrich you?

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا ٱلْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ
_v.en: So, as for the orphan, do not oppress him;

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّآئِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ
_v.en: and as for the beggar, do not chide him;

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ
_v.en: and as for your Lord’s blessing, proclaim it!

_v.ar: أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ
_v.en: Did We not open your breast for you

_v.ar: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنكَ وِزْرَكَ
_v.en: and relieve you of your burden

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ
_v.en: which [almost] broke your back?

_v.ar: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ
_v.en: Did We not exalt your name?

_v.ar: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
_v.en: Indeed ease accompanies hardship.

_v.ar: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
_v.en: Indeed ease accompanies hardship.

_v.ar: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَٱنصَبْ
_v.en: So when you are done, appoint,

_v.ar: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرْغَب
_v.en: and supplicate your Lord.

_v.ar: وَٱلتِّينِ وَٱلزَّيْتُونِ
_v.en: By the fig and the olive,

_v.ar: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
_v.en: by Mount Sinai,

_v.ar: وَهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ ٱلْأَمِينِ
_v.en: and by this secure town:

_v.ar: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ فِىٓ أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
_v.en: We certainly created man in the best of forms;

_v.ar: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَـٰهُ أَسْفَلَ سَـٰفِلِينَ
_v.en: then We relegated him to the lowest of the low,

_v.ar: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
_v.en: except those who have faith and do righteous deeds. There will be an everlasting reward for them.

_v.ar: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: So what makes you deny the Retribution?

_v.ar: أَلَيْسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحْكَمِ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
_v.en: Is not Allah the fairest of all judges?

_v.ar: ٱقْرَأْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ
_v.en: Read in the Name of your Lord who created;

_v.ar: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِنْ عَلَقٍ
_v.en: created man from a clinging mass.

_v.ar: ٱقْرَأْ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْأَكْرَمُ
_v.en: Read, and your Lord is the most generous,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَ بِٱلْقَلَمِ
_v.en: who taught by the pen,

_v.ar: عَلَّمَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ
_v.en: taught man what he did not know.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَيَطْغَىٰٓ
_v.en: Indeed man becomes rebellious

_v.ar: أَن رَّءَاهُ ٱسْتَغْنَىٰٓ
_v.en: when he considers himself without need.

_v.ar: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلرُّجْعَىٰٓ
_v.en: Indeed to your Lord is the return.

_v.ar: أَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى يَنْهَىٰ
_v.en: Tell me, he who forbids

_v.ar: عَبْدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰٓ
_v.en: a servant when he prays,

_v.ar: أَرَءَيْتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
_v.en: tell me, should he be on [true] guidance,

_v.ar: أَوْ أَمَرَ بِٱلتَّقْوَىٰٓ
_v.en: or bid [others] to Godwariness,

_v.ar: أَرَءَيْتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
_v.en: tell me, should he call him a liar and turn away

_v.ar: أَلَمْ يَعْلَم بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرَىٰ
_v.en: —does he not know that Allah sees [him]?

_v.ar: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
_v.en: No indeed! If he does not cease, We shall seize him by the forelock,

_v.ar: نَاصِيَةٍ كَـٰذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٍ
_v.en: a lying, sinful forelock!

_v.ar: فَلْيَدْعُ نَادِيَهُۥ
_v.en: Then let him call out his gang!

_v.ar: سَنَدْعُ ٱلزَّبَانِيَةَ
_v.en: We [too] shall call the keepers of hell.

_v.ar: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعْهُ وَٱسْجُدْ وَٱقْتَرِب ۩
_v.en: No indeed! Do not obey him, but prostrate and draw near [to Allah]!

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ فِى لَيْلَةِ ٱلْقَدْرِ
_v.en: Indeed We sent it down on the Night of Ordainment.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ ٱلْقَدْرِ
_v.en: And what will show you what is the Night of Ordainment?

_v.ar: لَيْلَةُ ٱلْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
_v.en: The Night of Ordainment is better than a thousand months.

_v.ar: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
_v.en: In it the angels and the Spirit descend, by the leave of their Lord, with every command.

_v.ar: سَلَـٰمٌ هِىَ حَتَّىٰ مَطْلَعِ ٱلْفَجْرِ
_v.en: It is peaceful until the rising of the dawn.

_v.ar: لَمْ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
_v.en: The faithless from among the People of the Book and the polytheists were not set apart [from the community of the faithful] until the proof had come to them:

_v.ar: رَسُولٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتْلُوا۟ صُحُفًا مُّطَهَّرَةً
_v.en: an apostle from Allah reciting impeccable scriptures,

_v.ar: فِيهَا كُتُبٌ قَيِّمَةٌ
_v.en: wherein are upright writings.

_v.ar: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَةُ
_v.en: Those who were given the Book did not divide except after the proof had come to them.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓا۟ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُوا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلْقَيِّمَةِ
_v.en: Though they were not commanded except to worship Allah, dedicating their faith to Him as men of pure faith, and to maintain the prayer and pay the zakat. That is the upright religion.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ فِى نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
_v.en: Indeed the faithless from among the People of the Book and the polytheists will be in the fire of hell, to remain in it [forever]. It is they who are the worst of creatures.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ ٱلْبَرِيَّةِ
_v.en: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds—it is they who are the best of creatures.

_v.ar: جَزَآؤُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا ۖ رَّضِىَ ٱللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا۟ عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِىَ رَبَّهُۥ
_v.en: Their reward, near their Lord, is the Gardens of Eden, with streams running in them, to remain in them forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is for those who fear their Lord.

_v.ar: إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا
_v.en: When the earth is rocked with a terrible quake

_v.ar: وَأَخْرَجَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا
_v.en: and discharges its burdens,

_v.ar: وَقَالَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مَا لَهَا
_v.en: and man says, ‘What is the matter with her?’

_v.ar: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخْبَارَهَا
_v.en: On that day she will relate her chronicles

_v.ar: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوْحَىٰ لَهَا
_v.en: for her Lord will have inspired her.

_v.ar: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِّيُرَوْا۟ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ
_v.en: On that day, mankind will issue forth in various groups to be shown their deeds.

_v.ar: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُۥ
_v.en: So whoever does an atom’s weight of good will see it,

_v.ar: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُۥ
_v.en: and whoever does an atom’s weight of evil will see it.

_v.ar: وَٱلْعَـٰدِيَـٰتِ ضَبْحًا
_v.en: By the snorting chargers,

_v.ar: فَٱلْمُورِيَـٰتِ قَدْحًا
_v.en: by the strikers of sparks [with their hoofs],

_v.ar: فَٱلْمُغِيرَٰتِ صُبْحًا
_v.en: by the raiders at dawn,

_v.ar: فَأَثَرْنَ بِهِۦ نَقْعًا
_v.en: raising therein a trail of dust,

_v.ar: فَوَسَطْنَ بِهِۦ جَمْعًا
_v.en: and cleaving therein a host!

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لِرَبِّهِۦ لَكَنُودٌ
_v.en: Indeed man is ungrateful to his Lord,

_v.ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٌ
_v.en: and indeed he is [himself] witness to that!

_v.ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لِحُبِّ ٱلْخَيْرِ لَشَدِيدٌ
_v.en: And indeed he is an avid lover of wealth.

_v.ar: أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِى ٱلْقُبُورِ
_v.en: Does he not know, when what is [buried] in the graves is turned over,

_v.ar: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِى ٱلصُّدُورِ
_v.en: and what is [concealed] in the breasts is divulged,

_v.ar: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّخَبِيرٌۢ
_v.en: on that day their Lord will be well informed about them [and their deeds]?

_v.ar: ٱلْقَارِعَةُ
_v.en: The Catastrophe!

_v.ar: مَا ٱلْقَارِعَةُ
_v.en: What is the Catastrophe?

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْقَارِعَةُ
_v.en: What will show you what is the Catastrophe?

_v.ar: يَوْمَ يَكُونُ ٱلنَّاسُ كَٱلْفَرَاشِ ٱلْمَبْثُوثِ
_v.en: [It is] the day when mankind will be like scattered moths

_v.ar: وَتَكُونُ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَٱلْعِهْنِ ٱلْمَنفُوشِ
_v.en: and the mountains like carded wool.

_v.ar: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ
_v.en: As for him, whose deeds weigh heavy in the scales,

_v.ar: فَهُوَ فِى عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ
_v.en: he will have a pleasing life.

_v.ar: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ
_v.en: But as for him, whose deeds weigh light in the scales,

_v.ar: فَأُمُّهُۥ هَاوِيَةٌ
_v.en: his home will be the Abyss.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا هِيَهْ
_v.en: And what will show you what it is?

_v.ar: نَارٌ حَامِيَةٌۢ
_v.en: It is a scorching fire!

_v.ar: أَلْهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ
_v.en: Rivalry [and vainglory] distracted you

_v.ar: حَتَّىٰ زُرْتُمُ ٱلْمَقَابِرَ
_v.en: until you visited [even] the graves.

_v.ar: كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: No indeed, soon you will know!

_v.ar: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
_v.en: No indeed, soon you will know for yet another time!

_v.ar: كَلَّا لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عِلْمَ ٱلْيَقِينِ
_v.en: Indeed, were you to know with certain knowledge,

_v.ar: لَتَرَوُنَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ
_v.en: you would have surely seen hell [in this very life].

_v.ar: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيْنَ ٱلْيَقِينِ
_v.en: Afterward you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.

_v.ar: ثُمَّ لَتُسْـَٔلُنَّ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَنِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
_v.en: Then, on that day, you will surely be questioned concerning the Blessing.

_v.ar: وَٱلْعَصْرِ
_v.en: By Time!

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَفِى خُسْرٍ
_v.en: Man is indeed in loss,

_v.ar: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ
_v.en: except those who have faith and do righteous deeds, and enjoin one another to [follow] the truth, and enjoin one another to patience.

_v.ar: وَيْلٌ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٍ لُّمَزَةٍ
_v.en: Woe to every scandal-monger and slanderer,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى جَمَعَ مَالًا وَعَدَّدَهُۥ
_v.en: who amasses wealth and counts it over.

_v.ar: يَحْسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُۥٓ أَخْلَدَهُۥ
_v.en: He supposes his wealth will make him immortal!

_v.ar: كَلَّا ۖ لَيُنۢبَذَنَّ فِى ٱلْحُطَمَةِ
_v.en: No indeed! He will surely be cast into the Crusher.

_v.ar: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْحُطَمَةُ
_v.en: And what will show you what is the Crusher?

_v.ar: نَارُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْمُوقَدَةُ
_v.en: [It is] the fire of Allah, set ablaze,

_v.ar: ٱلَّتِى تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى ٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةِ
_v.en: which will overspread the hearts.

_v.ar: إِنَّهَا عَلَيْهِم مُّؤْصَدَةٌ
_v.en: Indeed it will close in upon them

_v.ar: فِى عَمَدٍ مُّمَدَّدَةٍۭ
_v.en: in outstretched columns.

_v.ar: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْفِيلِ
_v.en: Have you not regarded how your Lord dealt with the army of the elephants?

_v.ar: أَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ كَيْدَهُمْ فِى تَضْلِيلٍ
_v.en: Did He not make their stratagems go awry,

_v.ar: وَأَرْسَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ طَيْرًا أَبَابِيلَ
_v.en: and send against them flocks of birds

_v.ar: تَرْمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٍ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
_v.en: pelting them with stones of shale,

_v.ar: فَجَعَلَهُمْ كَعَصْفٍ مَّأْكُولٍۭ
_v.en: thus making them like chewed-up straw?

_v.ar: لِإِيلَـٰفِ قُرَيْشٍ
_v.en: [In gratitude] for solidarity among the Quraysh,

_v.ar: إِۦلَـٰفِهِمْ رِحْلَةَ ٱلشِّتَآءِ وَٱلصَّيْفِ
_v.en: their solidarity during winter and summer journeys,

_v.ar: فَلْيَعْبُدُوا۟ رَبَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلْبَيْتِ
_v.en: let them worship the Lord of this House,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍۭ
_v.en: who has fed them [and saved them] from hunger, and secured them from fear.

_v.ar: أَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى يُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّينِ
_v.en: Did you see him who denies the Retribution?

_v.ar: فَذَٰلِكَ ٱلَّذِى يَدُعُّ ٱلْيَتِيمَ
_v.en: That is the one, who drives away the orphan,

_v.ar: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
_v.en: and does not urge the feeding of the needy.

_v.ar: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْمُصَلِّينَ
_v.en: Woe to those who pray

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَن صَلَاتِهِمْ سَاهُونَ
_v.en: but are heedless of their prayers

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ يُرَآءُونَ
_v.en: —who show off

_v.ar: وَيَمْنَعُونَ ٱلْمَاعُونَ
_v.en: but deny aid.

_v.ar: إِنَّآ أَعْطَيْنَـٰكَ ٱلْكَوْثَرَ
_v.en: Indeed We have given you abundance.

_v.ar: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَٱنْحَرْ
_v.en: So pray to your Lord, and sacrifice [the sacrificial camel].

_v.ar: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ ٱلْأَبْتَرُ
_v.en: Indeed it is your enemy who is without posterity.

_v.ar: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
_v.en: Say, ‘O faithless ones!

_v.ar: لَآ أَعْبُدُ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
_v.en: I do not worship what you worship,

_v.ar: وَلَآ أَنتُمْ عَـٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعْبُدُ
_v.en: nor do you worship what I worship;

_v.ar: وَلَآ أَنَا۠ عَابِدٌ مَّا عَبَدتُّمْ
_v.en: nor will I worship what you have worshipped,

_v.ar: وَلَآ أَنتُمْ عَـٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعْبُدُ
_v.en: nor will you worship what I worship.

_v.ar: لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِىَ دِينِ
_v.en: To you your religion, and to me my religion.’

_v.ar: إِذَا جَآءَ نَصْرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْفَتْحُ
_v.en: When Allah’s help comes with victory,

_v.ar: وَرَأَيْتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِى دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
_v.en: and you see the people entering Allah’s religion in throngs,

_v.ar: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابًۢا
_v.en: celebrate the praise of your Lord, and plead to Him for forgiveness. Indeed, He is all-clement.

_v.ar: تَبَّتْ يَدَآ أَبِى لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ
_v.en: Perish the hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!

_v.ar: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ
_v.en: Neither his wealth availed him, nor what he had earned.

_v.ar: سَيَصْلَىٰ نَارًا ذَاتَ لَهَبٍ
_v.en: Soon he will enter the blazing fire,

_v.ar: وَٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ حَمَّالَةَ ٱلْحَطَبِ
_v.en: and his wife [too], the firewood carrier,

_v.ar: فِى جِيدِهَا حَبْلٌ مِّن مَّسَدٍۭ
_v.en: with a rope of palm fibre around her neck.

_v.ar: قُلْ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
_v.en: Say, ‘He is Allah, the One.

_v.ar: ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ
_v.en: Allah is the All-embracing.

_v.ar: لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ
_v.en: He neither begat, nor was begotten,

_v.ar: وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌۢ
_v.en: nor has He any equal.’

_v.ar: قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلْفَلَقِ
_v.en: Say, ‘I seek the protection of the Lord of the daybreak

_v.ar: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
_v.en: from the evil of what He has created,

_v.ar: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ
_v.en: and from the evil of the dark night when it falls,

_v.ar: وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّـٰثَـٰتِ فِى ٱلْعُقَدِ
_v.en: and from the evil of the witches, who blow on knots,

_v.ar: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
_v.en: and from the evil of the envious one when he envies.’

_v.ar: قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ
_v.en: Say, ‘I seek the protection of the Lord of humans,

_v.ar: مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ
_v.en: Sovereign of humans,

_v.ar: إِلَـٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ
_v.en: God of humans,

_v.ar: مِن شَرِّ ٱلْوَسْوَاسِ ٱلْخَنَّاسِ
_v.en: from the evil of the sneaky tempter

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِى يُوَسْوِسُ فِى صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ
_v.en: who puts temptations into the breasts of humans,

_v.ar: مِنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ
_v.en: from among the jinn and humans.’
